loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Kikwechi W/g Group

texts.en:
Rose is the facilitator for Kikwechi W/G group.  Rose does not have any children at home, but lives with her husband, Peter.  Rose and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011, in order to get better maize yields from her farm. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

This year, Rose was able to harvest 14 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land, an excellent harvest.  Before joining One Acre Fund, Rose harvested only 5 bags of maize on 1/2 acre.  

With the income from her maize, Rose plans on buying livestock, investing in a business, and helping others. 

In the picture, Rose is with her group members holding baby cows, and her Field Officer Phyllis is on the far right.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a single woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are her water and electricity bills.  

For the past five years she has been operating a food café. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. In addition she operates a tailoring business from home which contributes as another source of income. She faces a major challenge in the seasonality of her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she is requesting she wants to establish a water selling shop and purchase pipes, taps and an electric water meter. Esha decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to establish a water selling shop and purchase pipes, taps and an electric water meter.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last 36 years. He is 54 years old and married to Beatrice. They have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Samuel hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ma.dela Paz

texts.en:
This is Ma.Dela Paz, age 54. She is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Numeriano, a carpenter, and a mother to her three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma.Dela Paz operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five Philippine Pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.     

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Ma.Delapaz hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand the product inventory in her business.

loans.name: Rab'aa

texts.en: Rab'aa is a 45-year-old woman. She is married and has five sons and three daughters. Some of her sons are employed. Her husband is a driving instructor and gets a decent income. Rab'aa has a car for training new drivers and wants to make repairs to it, but she hasn't enough money to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Rab'aa gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for all the repairs the car needs. This will make the car work more efficiently and her husband will take on more new drivers to train. That will lead to improving the family income positively and let the family live in better conditions. Rab'aa is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed in the car he uses for training new drivers.

loans.use: To pay for repairing the car that is used for training new drivers.

loans.name: Akylai's Group

texts.en:
Akylai is the leader of this group. She is 42 and together with her husband she raises five children: two daughters and three sons. The daughters are students, the older son helps in cattle breeding and the other two sons are preschool age (under seven). In order to earn money to meet the family's needs Akylai breeds cattle and sells dairy products. She applied for this loan because she needs additional funds to repair her house. In the near future she wants to build a shed to keep cattle and with the profits gained from the business she wishes to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
This is Felicitas, 43, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eufemio, her business partner, and mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Felicitas operates a variety store. In the Philippines a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1,000 in sales every day.     

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Felicitas hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos has practiced farming  for the last four years. He is 30 years old, married to Mary.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds, fertilizer and also pay for labor.

In the future, Amos hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsetsegmaa, 61, is a widow and lives with her daughter in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent) located in the slum district of  Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Since 1998 she has been running a business selling second hand shoes which have been imported from developed countries, and she has gained a lot of experience from it. She is a construction cost planner by profession, but she could not keep her work place due to illness. Now she rents a stall at Kharkhorin, the most crowded outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. Her daughter is a student at College, and Tsetsegmaa has to pay her annual fees and provides her with basic daily expenses. 

Tsetsegmaa buys her shoes from wholesalers who import them from abroad, and then cleans and fixes them and sells to customers. Since her daughter became a student she has started facing difficulties running her business due to lack of funds. Therefore she is requesting a loan to raise her income by increasing her working capital and selling more shoes to her customers.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and sell more shoes to her customers.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 49 years old and married with 3 children. Alberta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (variety store) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, groceries, etc to sell in her sari-sari store.

Alberta has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 6 years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Alberta aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additionals stocks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new machine for cleaning and preparing hens and to buy more cages

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 29 лет. Замужем. У него трое детей. Ее дети учатся в школе. Сама Гулмира имеет педагогическое образование. Она восемь лет как работает по профессии. Кроме того она занимается растениеводством. Она в основном сеет бахчевые культуры. Кредит берет для закупа семян лука и солярки.
texts.en: Gulmira lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 29 years old, married and has three children, all of whom attend school.  Gulmira has a pedagogical education.  She has been working in this field for eight years.  Besides this work, she is involved in agriculture.  She primarily plants melon cultures.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of onion seeds and diesel fuel.

loans.use: to buy seeds and diesel fuel

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has practiced farming for the last six years. She is a 48 year old widow and has two school going children in High School.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She has been loaned KES.20,000. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

In future, Ruth hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has practiced farming for the last four years. She is 47 years old and married to Remmi. They have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) on time. She has been loaned 40,000 KES. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Hannah hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 47 years old and married with two children ages 6 and 15. He runs a bar and restaurant in Georgebrook, a neighborhood in Freetown. His children are currently attending school.

David has owned this business for 20 years and sells drinks and food at the bar and restaurant. He also earns income from another business (a cinema hall). He says that the main challenge to his business is a lack of sufficient funds.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soft drinks, star beer, stout and food. David says that the extra income from this loan will help him to educate his children. In the future, he would like to expand to another outlet.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, star beer, stout and food.

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru:
Джурабек умный, целеустремленный и добросовестный муж. С детства он хотел иметь свой бизнес и получить от него много прибыли. Более 6 лет он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур а также скотоводством. В данном бизнесе помогает ему его жена, и они вместе дружно работает. Он выращивает фрукты и овощи и когда они вырастут, он продает их на местном рынке.  Джурабек мечтает о том, что когда- то он получит большую прибыль от своего бизнеса, и он хочет, построит красивый дом для своей семьи. С этой целью, он работает усердно день за днем. Джурабек хотел бы получит кредит в размере 10600 Сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений и семена.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Jurabek is a smart, goal-oriented and conscientious husband.  He has been wanting to have his own business and make a lot of profit from it since childhood.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops and in animal husbandry for over 6 years.  His wife helps him in this business, and they work well together.  He grows fruits and vegetables, and sells them at the local market once they are ripened.  Jurabek dreams of getting a large profit from his business and wants to build a beautiful home for his family.  He works very diligently day after day to achieve this goal.  Jurabek wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 10600 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has practiced farming for the last 16 years. He is 32 years old and married to Nduta. They have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) on time. He has been loaned 35,000 KES. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor.

In the future, Charles hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anara's Group

texts.en:
Anara is the leader of this group. She is 49 and, unfortunately, is a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. Her older son is a truck driver, her second son studies in the Police Academy, and her daughter is a student. Anara works as a bookkeeper for the Department of Agriculture. She applied for this loan because while she has saved some money from her salary, she needs additional funds to purchase a refrigerator. In the future she wants to see her children get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has operated his retail shop for the last four years. He is 44 years old and married to Susan. They have seven children who attend school.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all of his previous loans on time. He has been loaned 98,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods such as sugar, salt, rice, beans, soap, etc., to sell in his retail shop.

In the future, Peter hopes to grow his retail shop to a wholesale business.

loans.use: to restock his retail shop with sugar, salt, rice, beans, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, cooking oil, salt, margi, sugar, and other products in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine so that she can start making her own clothes to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 26 years old and single.  He runs a restaurant and has had this business for two years.  He earns an income of KES 10,000 per month.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET with which he plans to purchase stock such as cooking oil, flour, cereals, vegetables, and other similar products.  With the anticipated profit he will expand and increase his stock.

Patrick hopes to own a hotel with a guest lodge in the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, cereals, vegetables, and other similar products.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 45 years old and married with three children, aged between 12 and 30. She runs a provisions store in Grassfield, a neighborhood in Freetown. She also takes care of three relatives--those relatives also help on the housework. 

Kadiatu has been in this business for three years and sells milk, packet water, sugar and sardines at her store. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provisions and bags of rice. Kadiatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her profit and save more. In the future, she would like to open a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and bags of rice.

loans.name: Mariama Husain

texts.en:
Mariama is 37 years old and married with two children, ages 5 and 9, who are currently in primary school. She runs a building materials store in Lumley, in the western part of Freetown. 

Mariama has owned this business for 12 years and sells nails, shovels, pans and cement at her store. She also earns an income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuation and competition among sellers.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more building materials. Mariama says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to import building materials from around the word.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials such as nails, pans and shovels.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann has been a farmer for the last ten years. She is 27 years old, and married to James, with whom she has two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount of KES.10,000 to buy a dairy cow to supplement her milk supply.

In the future, Ann hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Savlat's Group

texts.en:
Savlat is the leader of this group. She is 56 and married to a builder. In order to earn money for their livelihood, Savlat breeds cattle. She has been in this business since 1990, so she has a lot of experience. By reselling cattle after fattening, she earns about 4000 soms per month. This profit made it possible for her to celebrate her daughter’s wedding and then her son’s. 

Now Savlat wants to start building a house. She needs some additional funds, so she applied for a loan. The purpose of the loan is to purchase cement. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cement.

loans.name: Faddah

texts.en: Faddah is 32 years old and a mother of three daughters. Her husband works as a driver for one of the telecommunication companies in Jordan. Being very good in time management, she was able to manage her time between raising her daughters and working at the grocery store she opened five years ago in the neighborhood. She now has a great reputation. She applied for this loan to add more food items to enrich her store with a variety of products.

loans.use: To add more food items to her store

loans.name: Muatar

texts.ru:
Муатар замужем и любящая мать 4 детей. Она честная и целеустремленная женщина. Более 22 года она занимается вышиванием свадебных нарядов, платье, национальные головные уборы (токи). Также она шьёт национальных халатов для невест (камзул). В месяц четыре раза она ездит за покупками товара. Этот бизнес приносить ей стабильный доход, и она хочет получить ещё больше прибыль от этого. Муатар хочет приобрести швейную машинку для вышивки для того чтобы расширить свой бизнес и получить ещё больше прибыли. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 1200$ США. Она заранее благодарит всех вас за поддержку и милосердие.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Muatar is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She is an honest and goal-oriented woman.  She has been involved in embroidering wedding attire, dresses, national head dresses (toki) for over 22 years.  She also sews national robes for brides (kamzul).  She travels to buy her materials four times per month.  This business brings in a stable income, and she wants to make a larger profit from it.  Muatar wants to purchase a sewing machine for embroidery in order to expand her business and make a larger profit.  She is requesting a loan of $1200 for this purpose.  She thanks all of you in advance for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for embroidery

loans.name: Almira's Group

texts.en:
Almira is the leader of this group. She is 32 and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she is raising two daughters and a son. The older daughter and the son are at school and the younger daughter is not yet school age. Thirteen years ago, Almira inherited two cows from her dad and since then has been engaged in livestock breeding. Almira applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase three sheep for breeding. She wants to increase her number of farm animals. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.ru: Elnur jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. Elnur 34 qoda. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya pereprodaji. Uje 6 let kak Elnur zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en: Elnur is married and has one child.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his beloved family.  Elnur is 34 years old.  He currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle for increasing the quantity of livestock for resale.  Elnur has been involved in animal husbandry for six years and breeds cows.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two cows which he will later sell at a profit.

loans.name: Grenik

texts.ru:
Гренику 53 года; он живет в городе Капане со своей женой, дочерью, сыном и невесткой. Почти 30 лет Греник проработал в милиции, а сейчас он на пенсии. Его жена домохозяйка, дочь работает парикмахершей, сын работает в полиции, а невестка работает учительницей в сельской школе.  
С 1990 года Греник занимается сельским хозяйством в деревне Верин Хотанан, откуда родом его родители. На своей ферме он разводит свиней и овец, выращивает овощи и фрукты, а также занимается пчеловодством. Часть полученной сельскохозяйственной продукции Греник оставляет для своей семьи, а оставшуюся продукцию продает своим постоянным покупателям в Капане. 
Греник хочет расширить свою ферму и для этой цели ему необходим кредит на сумму 800,000 драм для покупки шести бычков для своей фермы.
texts.en: Grenik is 53 years old.  He lives in the city of Kapan with his wife, daughter, son and daughter-in-law.  Grenik spent almost 30 years working as a policeman and is now retired.  His wife is a homemaker, daughter works as a hair stylist, son works as a policeman, and daughter-in-law works as a teacher in the village school.  Grenik has been involved in agriculture in the Verin Hotanan village since 1990.  This is where his parents are from.  He breeds pigs and sheep, grows vegetables and fruits and is also involved in beekeeping on his farm.  Grenik leaves some of the agricultural produce for his family and sells the remaining produce to his loyal customers in Kapan.  Grenik wants to expand his farm and needs a loan in the sum of 800,000 dram for the purchase of six calves for this farm.

loans.use: to buy six calves for his farm

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru:
Рахима честная, добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 5 детей. Она любит своих детей, и всегда удовлетворят их потребности. Более 10 лет она занимается купля продажей колбасных изделий и напитков. Она имеет свою торговую точку на центральном рынке и у неё много постоянных клиентов. Рахима старается привозить высококачественные продукты для своих клиентов, чтобы они были довольны. Рахима хочет добавить еще нового ассортимента продукта и с этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. Она хочет заранее благодарит Кива и Кива кредиторы за их поддержку и милосердие. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Rahima is an honest, trustworthy and hard-working woman. She is married and the loving mother of five. She loves her children and always takes care of them. For over 10 years, she has been reselling sausage products and beverages. She has her own stand at the Central market and has many loyal customers. Rahima makes an efforts to offer high-quality goods to her customers  in order to keep them  satisfied. Rahima would like to expand her selection of good, which is the reason she is requesting a loan in the amount of $2000. She thanks Kiva and Kiva lenders in advance for their support and kindness.More about Tajikistan and IMON International.

loans.use: to buy a new selection of goods

loans.name: Shakhla

texts.ru: Shakhla yavlyayetsya IDP personom, ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Shakhla 42 qoda. Ona uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Shakhla is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with her family.  She is married and has three children.  Shakhla is 42 years old.  She has been involved in poultry farming for ten years and breeds chickens.  She currently needs 2000 AZN to buy chickens for developing her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Josephine runs a bicycle repair shop in Voi. She has been in this business for the last four years. 

Josephine has been a KADET client and this marks her second loan to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to add more stock of spare parts to her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to add more stock of spare parts

loans.name: Rafig

texts.ru: Rafig jenat i iemeyt 3 detey. Yemu 57 let. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Rafig 11 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en: Rafig is married and has three children.  He is 57 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his wife and children.  Rafig has been involved in animal husbandry for 11 years.  He currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cows for resale.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to  buy peak milk, sardines, soft drinks, sugar, etc at wholesale

loans.name: Posseh

texts.en:
Posseh is 41 years old and married with three children, between 15 and 25 years old. She runs a boutique in Lumley in the western part of Freetown. She takes care of two relatives as well as their immediate ones. Her two children are currently attending secondary school.   

Posseh has owned this business for seven years and sells clothing, shoes, suitcases, bags and body sprays at her boutique. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenges to her business are the heavy rain when sales are slow and competition among sellers.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more boutique items. Posseh says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve the standard of living of her family. In the future, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, shoes, suitcases, bags and body sprays.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 59 years old and the widowed mother of two school-going children. She has been selling clothes (her primary business) and a clinic (her other source of income) for the last four years, making a monthly profit of KES 20,000. She has been loaned KES 50,000. She plans to use KES 25,000 to purchase more clothes to sell and KES 25,000 to purchase laboratory equipment.

With the anticipated profits made, she will build a nursing home for her community. In the future, she hopes to expand to neighboring communities.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and laboratory equipment.

loans.name: Fahmiya

texts.en: Fahmiya is a 46-year-old woman who is married with eight sons. Her husband is employed by the Ministry of Education with a decent salary. Fahmiya has its own project: a food stall for selling pastries and falafel, which is a Palestinian traditional dish. Fahmiya wants to purchase a new oven for baking pastries and a new machine for making falafel to improve her work. But the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Fahmiya takes the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase the machine and oven to improve the quality of food she is making and to sell more food to get better income and live with her family in better living conditions. Fahmiya is photographed in her food stall.

loans.use: To purchase an oven to make pastries and a machine for making falafel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy oranges, rice, palm oil, potatoes, cassava roots, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Muhammadayub

texts.ru:
Мухаммадаюб честный, добросовестный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и у них 2 детей. Он занимается выращиванием картошки, пшеница, а также ячмень для корма своего скота. Он начал свой бизнес 12 лет назад с выращиванием картошки. Раньше он имел 0,25 гектар земли, а теперь каждый год он расширяет свою землю до 3 гектара. Он намерен создать свое фермерское хозяйство.  С прибылью, который он планирует, он хочет использовать для расширения бизнеса, а часть его для ремонта своего дома. Мухаммадаюб хотел бы получить займ на сумму 3000$ США для покупки стока и оплата труда для уборки урожая. Данный бизнес является его единственным доходам, который он зарабатывает на содержание свою семью. Он надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его.

texts.en: Muhammadayub is an honest, conscientious and goal-oriented person.  He is married and has two children.  He is involved in growing potatoes, wheat and barley to feed his livestock.  He started his business twelve years ago with growing potatoes.  Previously, he had 0.25 hectares of land and now expands his land every year to 3 hectares.  He plans to create his own farm.  He plans to use the profits for expanding his business and partially for making repairs to his home.  Muhammadayub wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of livestock and payment of harvesting labor.  This business is his sole source of income, which he uses to support his family.  He hopes that the creditors will support him.

loans.use: to buy livestock and pay for harvesting labor

loans.name: Salim

texts.ru: Salim jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Salim 31 qoda. On seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. Salim uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec.
texts.en: Salim is married and has one child.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family.  Salim is 31 years old.  He currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy sheep for developing his business.  Salim has been involved in animal husbandry for four years and breeds sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one cow and two cattle

loans.name: Latafat

texts.en: Latafat is 43 years old. She purchases and resells cattle with her husband. She has three children. Latafat would like to request a loan of 1,200 AZN to purchase additional calves to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, Latafat would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase their income further.  Her monthly income from cattle breeding is 250 USD. She usually buys baby calves, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells at the central bazaar for higher price. She has already demonstrated herself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Furaha Group

texts.en:
Joyce is the facilitator for Furaha Group in Chwele. Joyce lives with her husband Mourice and four children. Joyce joined One Acre Fund in 2010 in order to make more profits from her maize harvests.  

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Joyce and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

In 2011, Joyce harvested 8 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land, a very good harvest by her measure.  Before joining One Acre Fund, Joyce was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 acre.

With the proceeds from her maize harvest, Joyce will pay for school fees, home improvements, save for the future, invest in livestock, and possibly invest in other business ventures.

In 2012, Furaha Group will plant 8.5 acres of land, with each farmer planting between .5 and 1.5 acres.

In the picture above, Joyce and her co-group members are holding young livestock (goats and one rabbit), while also showing off cobs from the recent harvest. The Furaha field officer is on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a hardworking businessman aged 38. He is married and blessed with four children. For the last 14 years, he has been operating a welding business to make a living. He makes window frames, doors and gates. He has managed to grow his business through financial support from Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy metal bars.

loans.use: To buy metal bars.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three cattle

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a hardworking businessman who is 30 years old. He is married with one child. For the last five years, he has been managing a business selling caps to make a living. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy caps. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy caps

loans.name: Zahera

texts.en: Zahera is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and has one son. She is employed by the Ministry of Education with a decent salary. To improve her income, she has her own project raising sheep and selling their products. Zahera wants to expand her project by purchasing more sheep in order to improve the family income, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Zahera gets the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to easily purchase more sheep and benefit from their products to increase and improve her income and live with her family in better conditions. Zahera is photographed in her project.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 42 years old and the single mother of a 24-year-old.  She has been able to raise up her child with the income she gets from her boutique.  She also earns extra income from her dairy farming.  She has retained her boutique for eight years because of financial support from Faulu Kenya.  

Margaret hopes to expand her boutique for more income generation.  She has requested 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gari, palm oil, rice, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat is a 26-year-old young woman who is married with two sons and one daughter. Her husband works in a bakery with a decent salary. Mervat has a project raising sheep. She benefits from selling products from the sheep, which is another good source of income for her family. Mervat wants to increase the benefits from raising sheep by purchasing more of them, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of JOD 600 from FATEN.

When Mervat takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will expand her project of raising sheep and sell extra amounts of sheep products, which will increase the family income and enable her to live with her family in better conditions. Mervat is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru:
Толибджон умный, целеустремленный и добрый человек. Он женат и у них 6 детей. Так как у него очень большая семья ему необходимо было зарабатывать много денег, чтобы он мог обеспечить свою семью и содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. Он много думал и решил, что выращивание сельскохозяйственных культур и скотоводство принесет ему хорошего дохода и более 30 лет он занимается этим бизнесом. В основном он выращивает ячмень для откорма своего скота. В настоящее время он имеет 3 голов коров и 20 голов барана. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и прибыль, который он планирует от данного бизнеса, он хочет, заплатить за учебу своего внука и внучки, кого он так сильно любить. Толибджон хотел бы получить займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота и корм для них. Он заранее благодарить вас за вашу помощь и поощрения.

texts.en: Tolibjon is a smart, goal-oriented and kind person.  He is married and has six children.  Because he had such a large family, he needed to earn a lot of money in order to support his family and provide good living conditions for them.  He thought a lot and decided that growing agricultural crops and animal husbandry would earn him a good income, and he has now been involved in this business for over 30 years.  He primarily grows barley to feed his livestock.  Currently, he has three cows and twenty sheep.  He wants to expand his business and increase his profit, which he is planning to receive from this buisness, and wants to pay for his grandchildren, who he loves very much, to go to school.  Tolibjon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of livestock and livestock feed.  He thanks you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a hardworking businessman who is 33 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last five years, he has been managing a taxi transport business to make a living. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy tires. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more business oriented.

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes in wholesale to sell

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 36 years old and married with three children. He runs a retail shop so as to earn a living for his family. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person.  Besides (this business), he is employed as a driver. Previously, he used to sell second-hand clothes.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and cereals to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruits and cereals to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more timber and carpentry working tools.

loans.name: Azimchon

texts.ru:
Азимчон женат и у них 5 детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, а также скотоводством. Азимчон добрый и умный человек. Его ценят, и любить все его друзья и родственники. Он старается всегда помогать всем. Азимчон выращивает ячмень для своего скота, а также продает на местном рынке. Он хотел бы получить займ  в размере 2200$ США для покупки скота. Он хочет заранее благодарить Кива и Кива кредиторов за их поддержку и милосердие. Спасибо вам! Ваша помощь нужна нам!

texts.en: Azimchon is married and has five children.  He is involved in growing agricultural crops and also animal husbandry.  Azimchon is a kind and smart person.  All his friend and relatives value and love him.  He always tries to help everyone.  Azimchon grows barley for this livestock and also sells it at the local market.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2200 for the purchase of livestock.  He wants to thank Kiva and Kiva creditors in advance for their support and mercy.  Thank you!  Your help is necessary to us!

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Earnest

texts.en:
Earnest is a business man aged 39. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last 2 years, he has been managing a printing business to earn a living. Previously, he used to sell bread. In the next 5 years, he wants to open another outlet of his business. 

He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a computer. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To buy computer

loans.name: Batuli

texts.en:
Batuli is a 66 year old married lady, with seven children. She sells charcoal in the Kisumu Ndogo area in Malindi, and has been in the business for the past five years now. She earns a monthly income of Kshs.5,000 and usually uses the money to assist her husband in taking care of their family.

Batuli has been loaned Kshs.20,000 by KADET LTD and this serves as her first loan cycle. She intends to use her loan to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell, as well as to put up a strong wooden structure for her business, with a view of being able to serve her ever growing customers in the area (since no one else conducts the same kind of business in the area). 

The client wishes to use the anticipated profit from her business to continue helping look after her family as well as to help grow her business by opening a water selling point in the area.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 50 years old and married and with five children. He has a van transport business to earn a living.  He has been operating his business for six years.  He also does dairy farming for more income generation. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to provide better education to his children. Francis hopes to buy more vans for his transport business in five years.  He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to service his van.

loans.use: To service his van

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 38 years old and married with two children, ages three and seven. He runs a general merchandise store in Lumley in the western part of Freetown. His two children are currently attending school. 

Mohamed has been in this business for five years and sells bread, sugar, soap, body cream, mosquito spray and sardines at his store. His business is the main source of income that he has. He says that the main challenges to his business are price fluctuation and heavy rains.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provisions and cosmetics items. Mohamed says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living. In the future, he would like to import goods from overseas.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and cosmetics

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a businesswoman who is 54 years old. She is single and blessed with one child. For the last 10 years, she has been managing a retail shop to make a living. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar and rice. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save part of her income.

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a hardworking businesswoman aged 34. She is married and blessed with three children. For the last five years, she has been managing a retail shop to make a living. Previously, she was involved with a business selling groceries. In the next five years, she wants to operate a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar and cooking fat. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save part of her income.

loans.use: To buy sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 39 years old, married with three children in school.  To earn a living, she sells second-hand clothes.  She has been in the business for seven years.  In addition, she does dairy farming for more income generation.  She hopes to expand her business within five years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a hardworking businessman who is aged 24 and single. For the last three years, he has been managing a business which does printing and photography to make a living. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.  He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a camera. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To buy a camera

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her means to buy a large quantity of food products (oil,rice,industrial beer) for resale to make a big profit.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a married man with three children.  To earn a living, he runs a retail shop.  He has operated the business for two years.  He has been able to grow the business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because he has been trained in business management skills.

Dominic hopes to expand his business into wholesale in five years.  He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, salt and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, salt and maize flour.

loans.name: Kavini

texts.en:
For the last 10 years Kavini has been selling cereals at the same time operating a posh mill in Kako, Makueni town. In a posh mill, grains are ground into flour. She is 51 years old and married to Peter. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET staff member. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to purchase 10 bags of maize.

In the future, Kavini hopes to expand her business and to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bags of maize.

loans.name: Edina

texts.es: La señora Edina trabaja como recepcionista y también se dedica a la venta de carteras y perfumes. El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital, el cual lo invertirá en la adquisición de perfumes para varón. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona Alto Chijini en la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene un  hijo. Esta es la segunda vez que su préstamo es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Edina works as a receptionist and also sells handbags and perfumes. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital since she plans to invest in the acquisition of men’s colognes. She lives at her parents’ house which is located in the District of Alto Chijini in the city of La Paz. Edina is married and has one child.

This is the second time that her loan has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy colognes for men.

loans.name: Schola

texts.en: Schola is a hardworking businesswoman who is aged 48 and married. For the last 20 years, she has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. In the next five years, she wants to increase the number of cows on her farm. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy animal feed. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her cows

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: El señor Gonzalo trabaja como chef y tiene su propio negocio. El crédito lo requiere para la inscripción  en la universidad y seguir cursos de cocina. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa El Carmen en la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y no  tiene hijos. Es cliente antiguo desde el año 2006, y esta es la cuarta vez que su solicitud de préstamo se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Gonzalo works as a chef and has his own business. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay his university tuition so that he can continue taking cooking courses. He lives at the home of his parents in the District of Villa El Carmen in the city of La Paz. Gonzalo is single and has no children.

He has been a longtime client since 2006. This is the fourth time that his loan request has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to pay for his cooking courses at the university.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: La señora Betty confecciona edredones; es dueña de  un pequeño taller de costura. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima, como ser telas, hilos, etc., y también para la compra de una máquina recta y una máquina obber. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Victoria en la ciudad de La Paz , es casada y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y por el carácter productivo y empresarial del mismo es que va a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Betty makes bedspreads and is the owner of small sewing workshop. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy raw materials such as fabrics, thread, and other supplies. She will also buy an upright sewing machine and a bobbin machine. Betty lives at the home of her parents located in the District of Villa Victoria in the city of La Paz. She is married and has one child.

This is the first time she has obtained a loan through IMPRO. Due to her productive and entrepreneurial qualities, Betty’s loan is being referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, an upright sewing machine, and a bobbin machine.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La señora Rosmery trabaja como despachadora de productos textiles en una empresa textilera  y su esposo trabaja como chofer asalariado en una línea de radio taxis de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su vivienda. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Alto Sopocachi  ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz, es casada  y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosmery works as a dispatcher of textile products for a textile company.  Her husband is a salaried driver for a fleet of radio taxis in the city of La Paz.  The loan she is requesting will be used for repairs to her home.  She lives at her parents’ house in the District of Alto Sopocachi in the city of La Paz.  Rosmery is married and has two children.

This is the first time she has obtained a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her parents' house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and sugar in bulk.

loans.name: Alan

texts.es: El señor Alan trabaja como abogado en un buffet. El crédito lo requiere para la compra  de un ambiente donde instalará su oficina para poder independizarse profesionalmente. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Fatima en la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Alan ya ha tenido una experiencia de préstamo a través de Kiva  y ahora desea hacerlo por segunda vez.
texts.en:
Sr. Alan works as an attorney at a law firm. The loan he is requesting will be used to acquire a location where he can set up his office and become professionally independent. He lives at the home of his parents in the District of Villa Fatima in the city of La Paz. Alan is single and has no children.

He has had one previous loan that was funded through Kiva and now he is requesting a second loan.

loans.use: to acquire a location where he can set up his law practice.

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es: El señor Policarpo es empleado en un hotel y tiene una microempresa de fabricación de galletas. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una batidora  eléctrica  para aumentar la  producción de las mismas. Vive en  alquiler  ubicada en la zona de Villa Nueva Potosí  en la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltero  y no tiene hijos. Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2010 y esta es la segunda vez que apela a Kiva para el fondeo de este crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Policarpio is a hotel employee, but he also has a small business making cookies. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy an electric mixer so that he can increase his production of cookies. He lives in a rental property in the District of Villa Nueva Potosí in the city of La Paz. Policarpio is single and has no children.

He has been a client of IMPRO since 2010 and this is the second time his loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy an electric mixer for making cookies.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33 years old and married to Pascaline. They have two children aged between one and six.  He has been doing carpentry work for the last two years making a monthly profit of KES.27,000. With his loan of KES.30,000, he plans to purchase more timber to use and sell.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business and educate his children to university level. In the future, he hopes to own his own timber yard and open a furniture showroom.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to use and sell

loans.name: Flor De Luz

texts.es:
La señora Flor de Luz vive en un barrio donde se celebra la fiesta de San Mateo, ella es casada con el señor Gilberto y con quien procreo  dos hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el  préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para su estética como tintes, tijeras, etc; lleva practicando ésta actividad 22 años y cuatro meses.

   Ella se inspiro en esta actividad  ya que  su mamá la mando a cursos en en la ciudad cercana a su comunidad y cuando logró su especializacion y le otorgaron sus reconocimienro ella comenzpo a cortar cabello.

    Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad pueda seguir trabajando para apoyar a sus hijos que están estudaindo.
texts.en:
Flor de Luz lives in a neighborhood where the festival of San Mateo is celebrated. She is married to Gilberto, and they are still raising their two children.

She is seeking this loan in order to invest in materials for her salon such as dyes, scissors, etc.  She has been in this business for 22 years and four months.

She was inspired to go into this business when her mother sent her to take courses in the city close to them. When she completed her course and earned her degree, she began to cut hair.

What she wants most is to be able to continue working in this business in order to support her children, who are now in school.

loans.use: to buy products and materials for her salon.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina  vive en una localidad en la que  el día dos de febrero celebra la fiesta de la virgen de candelaria, ella es casada con el señor Pedro y con quien procreo siete hijos quienes ya están casados.
   
     Ella se dedica a la panadería y solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como leche, arina, sal, levadura, etc., y así poder elaborarlo, en esta actividad lleva practicando  treinta y un años ocho meses en la que comenta que le va bien.
 
    Ella se inspiro en esta actividad ya que desde muy joven lo practica  y le va muy bien desde que inicio con ello ya que así logro apoyar a su  esposo para sacar adelante a su familia.

 Lo que más  desea es que con esta actividad pueda seguir trabajando  hasta que dios le preste vida.
texts.en:
Marina lives in an area where the Festival of the Virigin of Candelaria is celebrated on February 2nd.   She lives with her husband Pedro, with whom she raised six children, who are all now married.

She owns a bakery, and is seeking this loan in order to invest in ingredients such as milk, flour, salt, yeast, etc. for baking bread.  She has been in this business for thirty-one years and eight months and says that it is going well.

She was inspired to do this work when she was a young child.  Her business has done very well since she started it.  She has been able to help her husband provide a better life for her family.

What she wants most is to continue with this business as long as God grants her life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking bread.

loans.name: Magdali

texts.es:
La señora Magdali, es casada  con el señor  José Ariel y con quien procreo tres hijos que aun estaña su responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: carne,  tortilla, aceite, repollo, entre otros para la elaboración de taco, en donde lleva practicando   dos años y ocho meses  y comenta que le va bien.

     Se inspiro en esta actividad ya que  quiere apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de  la casa, para así sacar adelante a su familia que es lo más importante para ella.
 
     Lo que más desea es  que con esta pequeña actividad pueda ir aumentando su ganancia, así  a poyar a sus hijos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Magdali is married to José Ariel and the couple have three children who are still their responsibility.

Magdali requested this loan to invest in buying ingredients such as meat, tortillas, oil, cabbage, etc. for making tacos.  She has been in this business for two years and eight months and she tells us that it is doing well.

Magdali decided to start this business as she wanted to support her husband by making income for their household in order to get their family ahead in life.  Her family is the most important thing in the world to her.

What Magdali would most like is to be able to gradually increase her income through her business so that she can support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making tacos

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 34-year-old married man with five children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him and his desire is to educate his children up to university. He has been in the transport sector for two years and he bought the motorcycle which he rides by himself from the money he had saved from selling his farm products. His hardships include road accidents and high fuel costs. Nonetheless, his vision is to buy five motorcycles so that he can increase his daily income. John needs the loan facility to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 50-year-old widow with five children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Ever since her husband died, she has been solely taking care of her children and her desire is to see them employed or setting up income generating activities. She has been in the stationery business for 17 years in which she acquired capital from her late husband's pension. Her hardship is bad debtors and her vision is to set up at least two more stationery shops. Florence needs the loan facility to buy books, pens, papers, files, gift cards and success cards to sell.

loans.use: To buy books, pens, papers, files, gift cards and success cards to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy drinks and pay school fees.

loans.name: La Loma Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama "L. Loma" las integarntes del grupo mencionaron que cuando inicio el grupo los tramites se realizaban en un paraje un paraje que esta en lo mas alto D. su comunidad por eso decidieron ponerle este nombtre al grupo. 
El grupo esta conformado por ocho personas, en donD. solo hay un hombre, Bertha que es L. representante dice "Es L. primera vez que me ponen como representante del grupo sin embargo piezo echarle mucahs ganas para que todos pagen a tiempo, el prestamo lo solicita para invertir en L. activiada que realizo es L. venta D. calcetines, los cuales mi mama me los trae D. puebL. ya que un tio alL. los fabrica y yo se los compro me conviene porque me los da mas baratos, esta vez comprare calcetines, calentadores, calcetas, tobilleras, uno D. los deasfios que presento es cuando mis vecinas no me quieren pagar porque yo salgo a ofrecerles y en L. escueL. D. mis niñas tambien vendo con las maestras. Ya que les doy fiado en el negocio llevo aproximadamente un año. Mis esperanzas son que el negocio prospere y pueda hacerme D. un lugar estable para vender mis calcetas y vender otro tipo D. ropa"
ElL. tiene 28 años esta casada con el señor Erasmo desD. hace 10 años tiene dos niñas una D. 9 años estudia en 4 año D. primaria, L. mas pequeña Citlaly esta en el preeescolar.
Las integrantes del grupo invertiran en otar cosas como Julia en Costuras e hilos, MarceL. en pollos, Andrea en borregos, Margarita en borregos, Roberto en tienda, AngeL. en ropa, Juana borregos. En general todos estan muy coontentos por el credito que les otorgaron.
***En L. foto no aparece Marce ya que elL. firmo el contrato aparte en otro horario cuestiones familiares***
texts.en:
This group is called 'L. Loma' (The Hill).  The group's members mention that when they set up their group, they held their meetings in a place which is located in the highest spot in their community.  This is why they decided to give the group this name.

The group has eight members and only one man.  Bertha, the group's representative, says "this is the first time that I have been chosen as the group's representative but I am very keen for everybody to make their payments on time.  I am requesting this loan to invest in my business selling socks.  My mom brings them from PuebL. for me. I have an uncle there who makes them and I buy them from him.  It works for me because he gives them to me cheap.  On this occasion, I will buy socks, leg warmers, knee-high socks and ankle socks.  One of the challenges I face is when my neighbors don't want to pay me.  I go out to sell my products and I also sell them to the teachers in my daughters' school.  I sell them on credit.  I have been in business for approximately one year.  I hope that my business will do well and that I will be able to find a stable place where I can sell my socks and also sell other types of clothes".

Bertha is 28 years old.  She has been married to Erasmo for 10 years and has two daughters.  Her eldest daughter is 9 years old and in the fourth year of elementary school.  Her youngest, Citlaly, is in pre-school.

The other members of this group will invest their money in other things.  Julia will invest her money in sewing supplies and threads, MarceL. will buy chickens, Andrea will buy lambs, Margarita will buy lambs, Roberto will invest in his store, AngeL. will invest in clothes and Juana will invest in lambs.  In general, all the members of the group are happy with the loan that they are receiving.

* Marce is missing from the photo.  She signed the contract separately on another day for family reasons.

loans.use: to buy ankle socks, knee-high socks and leg warmers

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 35 años, es mujer alegre. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a Marcial, su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 4 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Alianza. Como mujer del campo, luchadora y trabajadora, ella se dedica a varias actividades. Su tienda es una de las más visitadas en la comunidad, desde muy temprano abre sus puertas en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Además de dedicarse a la siembra de café y plátanos en su terreno agrícola de poca extensión, donde trabaja los fines de semana para mantenerlos muy fuertes. Además comenta que trabaja en una hacienda de gran producción, donde recoge los frutos maduros y le pagan un dinero extra por ello. Lo que más le gusta a Carmen, es poder pasar su tiempo ocupada y trabajando para el futuro de su familia, pues gasto la mayor parte de sus ganancias en cuidarlos, alimentarlos y educarlos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Alianza al progreso” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde pagará todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, además de estar agradecida por el apoyo brindado. Carmen de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de maíz híbrido y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales que le servirán para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Carmen, 35, is a happy woman. She lives in a rented house with Marcial, her husband of twenty years. Together they have five children, only four of whom live with them in their house in the rural community of Alianza. As a country woman, hard-working and a fighter, she makes her living in a number of ways. Her store is one of the most-visited in the community. She opens her doors early in the morning in the hope that her neighbors will come buy the things they need.  Carmen is a happy and thoughtful shopkeeper, always greeting her customers with a smile and is disposed to help them out with their selections. 

Carmen also plants coffee and bananas on a small plot of farmland, which she works hard on the weekends to maintain. She tells us she also works on a big plantation, where she makes extra money picking ripe fruit.  What she likes best is to be able to pass her time busy and working for her family's future. She spends most of her income on their care, feeding, and education.

Carmen belongs to the "Alianza al Progreso" [Alliance for Progress] Village Bank and is on her fifth loan with MFP, where she'll make all of her payments on time because she does not want to cause the bank problems, and she's grateful for their support. When she gets her loan, Carmen will invest in the purchase of hybrid corn seed and some sacks of natural fertilizer that she'll use for the next planting season.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon is a 58-year-old married man with six children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has operated a textile shop specifically dealing in school uniforms for 30 years. He started the business in 1980 with capital of 25,000 shillings saved from coffee sales and now has a stock of 10,000,000 shillings. His hardship is high taxes and his vision is to operate in his own premises plus to educate his children. Gideon needs the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso, de 25 años, es un joven sencillo. Vive con su papá Oscar, su mamá Jivia y sus 2 hermanos; en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Alianza y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. Como joven soltero, él tiene muchas ambiciones. Todas las mañanas se esmera mucho en trabajar sus tierras y dejarlas muy fértiles, ya que sabe que de eso depende la calidad de su naranja, mandarina, plátanos y maíz que siembra en sus 3 terrenos, los cuales posteriormente después de la cosecha llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced y en épocas de mayor venta los lleva a la ciudad de Lima (capital del país). Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene mucha libertad, pues son sus propias tierras y es su propio jefe, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es hacer la limpieza de sus plantaciones de café. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción, además de tener mayor ingreso económico para poder ayudar a sus hermanos que todavía son niños. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Alianza al progreso” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, pues es un joven trabajador. Además agradece al poyo de todos ustedes. Alfonso, está pensando replantar sus cultivos de plátanos y maíz híbrido; por ello de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus nuevos cultivos.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 25 years old and is a simple young man who lives with his father Oscar, his mother Jivia, and his 2 brothers in their family home in the community of Alianza. What he most desires is to get ahead in life. As a single young person, he has many ambitions. Every morning anew, he takes great pains with his work to make his crops very productive. He knows that the quality of the oranges, tangerines, plantains, and corn that he sows on his 3 fields depends on this effort.

After harvest, he will sell the resulting crops in the city market at La Merced. When sales are increasing, he takes them to the harvest to the city of Lima (the capital of the country).
