She now tells us that she finished her harvest, and she obtained good profits.  At the same time, she divides her time helping other farmers tend to their crops, and earns extra money.  Likewise, she is preparing for the harvest of her orange crop in the month of November.

She belongs to the “Flor de Almendra” (“Almond Flower”) cooperative bank, and this is her seventh loan with MFP.  She is a very responsible woman, and hopes to obtain good results with the work of her association.  Likewise, she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.

Teresa, after the harvest, will start the clean up of her grove of coffee plantings.  For this reason, at receiving your support, she will invest the requested funds into buying tools to start her work.

loans.use: buy farming tools.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 47 años vive en concubinato con Alfredo. Con quien tiene 6 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). Sus días se centran en el cuidado de sus cultivos, los cuales realiza con mucho esmero desde hace 26 años. En todo este tiempo logró sacar un buen grano de café, frutos grandes y dulces, como es el caso de los cítricos, asimismo el infaltable achiote, que comenzó a sembrar ahora último. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto con la naturaleza, pues se siente tranquila y relajada. Por ello cuenta que en temporada de recolección de naranja; ella sale a trabajar como peón en diversos terrenos agrícolas, donde le pagan un dinero extra. Además de tener el apoyo de su esposo, que se dedica al trasporte público cubriendo las rutas Kivinaki – Cerro Picaflor, donde obtiene un dinero extra. Sus planes son seguir mejorando sus sembríos para poder obtener cada día mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde trabajará con mucho esmero para poder cumplir las metas que se propuso. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Martha está pensando limpiar sus plantaciones, por ello de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago del salario a los peones que le ayudarán en este trabajo.
texts.en: Martha is 47 years old. She is in a common law marriage with Alfredo, with whom she has 6 hijos. Only 2 of them are living in her home, which she owns and is located in the native community of Kivinaki (central Peruvian jungle). Her time revolves around taking care of her crops, which she has worked very hard on for 26 years. The whole time she has been able to obtain good coffee beans, big and sweet. She has done the same with citrus and the inevitable annato seeds, which she recently started planting. What she likes the most about her job is being in contact with nature, because it makes her feel relaxed and calm. When it is time to harvest the oranges, she works as a laborer in different farms, where she earns extra money. She also has her husband's support. He works in public transport, covering the routes between Kivnaki and Cerro Picaflor, where he makes extra money. Her plans are to continue improving her crops in order to earn more every day. She belongs to a communal bank called “Flor de Almendra”. This is her second loan with MFP, where she will work very hard to meet the goals she has set for herself. She also promises to make her payments on time. Martha is planning on clearing her fields, and for that she needs your help. She will invest the money she has asked for in paying the wages of the laborers who will help her with this work.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Clever

texts.es: Clever, de 22 años es un joven trabajador que vive junto a su tía Bilda en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). Con el amor y respeto que tiene a su tía a quien la quiere como a una madre; comenzó hace 4 años a producir la tierra que heredó, es así que comenzó a sembrar cítricos en toda sus variedades, los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación, pues constantemente vienen los comerciantes de frutas a comprar sus cosechas en el mismo terreno agrícola. Ahora desea incursionar en la siembra de “achiote” a gran escala, ya está dando el primer paso; pues tiene terrenos agrícolas en Puerto Bermúdez. Cuenta que también está planeando, sembrar cacao. Más le dificulta tener poco capital de trabajo, por ello tendrá que trabajar muy duro e ir poco a poco cumpliendo su objetivo. Cuenta que dentro de unos meses comenzará la cosecha de naranja y espera obtener buenas ganancias como en la última cosecha de tállelo (fruta cítrica). Él pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde es el único hombre. Por tal motivo promete fomentar el respeto y responsabilidad en su asociación. Además de pagar puntual sus cuotas. Clever de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para limpiar sus terrenos de cultivo, después de la ardua cosecha.
texts.en:
Clever, 22, is a young worker who lives with his aunt Bilda in their own house, located in the native community of Kivinaki (central Peruvian jungle). He loves and respects his aunt as if she was his own mother. 

He began farming the land he inherited 4 yeas ago. He started off with all kinds of citrus fruits, which he looks after with great dedication. Fruit traders constantly visit his lands to buy his crops. Now he would like to venture into the large-scale farming of "achiote". He has taken his first steps, as he has land in Puerto Bermudez. He also explains that he's planning to grow cocoa. His challenge is having very little working capital, which means he'll have to work very hard and achieve his goal little by little. He says that in a few months he will start the orange harvest and that he expects good profits from the latest crop of "taello", a citrus fruit.

He is a member of the "Flor de Almendra" ("Almond Blossom") communal bank and this is his second loan with MFP, where he is the only man. He is committed to promoting respect and responsibility within the organisation, as well as to repaying the loan on time. If Clever receives your support he will invest the money requested in the purchase of tools to clear his farmland after the hard harvest time.

loans.use: to buy farming tools.

loans.name: Bilda

texts.es: Bilda, de 48 años es una mujer admirable que enviudó hace un año. A pesar del dolor que siente, lucha por cuidar a sus 3 hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Kivinaki (selva central peruana). Luchadora incansable, así definimos a Bilda. Ella es jefa de la comunidad y como tal apoya y ayuda a los pobladores, asimismo es vicepresidenta de la sociedad de mujeres nativas del país; donde ayuda a hacer trabajos de capacitación en temas de biodiversidad y derechos humanos. Pero como mujer del campo, hace 8 años que se dedica a la siembra de cítricos en toda su variedad. En sus 5 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, no solo comparte la pasión por la siembra, también la dicha de poder producir la tierra. Ahora el proyecto que tiene es la siembra de “sachainchi” un alimento medicinal oriundo de la selva, que cura el cáncer y gastritis. En el país se habla mucho de esta hierva y como tiene extensas áreas agrícolas en Puerto Bermúdez, desea comenzar con este proyecto, donde asume ganará de S/. 400 a S/. 500 nuevos soles el kilo. Desea obtener buenas cosechas y expandir sus terrenos, por ello trabajará con ahínco por su objetivo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera encontrar un aliado para la realización de sus proyectos. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Bilda dará el primer paso en su proyecto, por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de cacao, achiote y sachainchi.
texts.en:
Bilda, 48, is an admirable woman who became widowed a year ago. Despite the pain that she feels, she is fighting to care for her 3 sons in her own home located in the indigenous community of Kivinaki (in the central Peruvian forest). Thus we define Bilda as the tireless fighter she is. She is the head of the community and as such, she supports and helps the other inhabitants. She is also vice president of the Society of Indigenous Women in the country, where she helps in training others about biodiversity and human rights. 

In addition, as a woman of the land, she began planting citrus fruits in all their varieties 8 years ago. On her 5 hectares of agricultural land [approximately 12.4 acres] she not only savors her passion for planting, but also the happiness of being able to make the land productive. 

Bilda’s current  project is the cultivation of sacha inchi, an indigenous forest medicinal food plant that cures cancer and gastritis [sacha inchi is one of the highest sources of essential fatty acids found to date]. This plant has generated a great deal of interest in her country and, as there are extensive agricultural areas in Puerto Bermúdez, Bilda wants to begin her project there, where she feels she will earn from 400 to 500 nuevos soles a kilo. She wants to obtain good harvests and expand her holdings and she will work zealously to achieve her objective.

Bilda belongs to the Flor de Almendra communal bank and this is her seventh loan with MFP, where she hopes to find an ally to help her  achieve her goals. Thus, she promises to be punctual in making her payments. She will take the first step in the project described above if she receives your support: she will use the money to buy cacao, annatto and sacha inchi seeds.

loans.use: to buy cacao, annatto and sacha inchi seeds.

loans.name: Clavelia

texts.es: Clavelia, de 40 años vive en concubinato con José, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos a los que cuida con mucho amor en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). Desde muy joven, comenzó a trabajar como peón en otros cultivos. Con el dinero que le pagaba junto un pequeño capital, con lo que hace 3 años compró 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, ahí comenzó a sembrar café, cítricos, achiote y maíz en poca escala. Pues necesita generar ingresos en corto tiempo. Ahora vende al menudeo sus cosechas, pero con el tiempo, esmero y dedicación logrará obtener el capital necesario para poder sembrar en mayores cantidades, y así obtener mejores ganancias. Sabe que en el camino encontrará muchos inconvenientes, eso no la desanima, ya que recibe el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja como peón en otros cultivos, podando y matapaleando los frutos cítricos (proceso de recolección del fruto maduro por medio de palos largos). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, entidad respetada en su comunidad por el apoyo que brinda a los agricultores de la zona. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Hace poco los cafetales de Clavelia se quemaron producto de la plaga que azotó el lugar y el calor intenso. Por está razón de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 3 mil plantitas nuevas de café que piensa sembrar; asimismo en la limpieza de sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Clavelia, age 40, lives in a common-law marriage with José, her husband.  They have two children whom they take care of with a lot of love.  They live in their own house in the native community of Kivinaki (central Peruvian jungle).

When she was very young she started working as a farmworker on other peoples’ crops.  Three years ago, with the money they paid her, and together with a small amount of capital, she bought two hectares of farmland.  That is where she started to grow coffee, citrus fruits, annatto, and corn on a small scale.

She needs to generate income in a short amount of time.  She now sells her harvests for retail.  However, in time and with care and dedication she will manage to get the money she needs to be able to plant in greater quantities.  That way she will get better income.  She knows that there will be many obstacles along the way, but this does not discourage her, because she has her husband’s support.  He works as a farmworker pruning and “matapaleando” (process of harvesting mature fruit by using large sticks) other crops.

She belongs to the “Flor de Almendra” (Almond Flower) Communal Bank.  This is her second loan with MFP, an entity that is respected by her community for the support they give to farmers in the zone.  She pledges to be punctual making her payments.

A little while ago Clavelia’s coffee fields were burned because of the pest infestation that afflicted the area and the intense heat.  That is the reason for the loan.  She will use the requested money to buy 3,000 new coffee plants that she plans to grow and in the clearing of her fields.

loans.use: to buy 3,000 coffee plants.

loans.name: Decsi Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Decsi, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tiene 6 hijos, dos mayores de edad y los cuatro menores que  estudian en colegio y escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.
 
Nuestra amiga se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres junto con su esposo, él vende puerta a puerta pues recorre en un triciclo por toda la ciudad, mientras ella vende las legumbres en un local que tiene en su casa. Es un negocio pequeño pero esto le permite ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia. Ella trabaja todos los días desde las 4h00 horas hasta las 18h00  y su esposo hace sus recorridos hasta el medio día y luego llega a casa y le ayuda en su local. Llevan más de 15 años con su negocio el mismo que es sacrificado pero les ha dado para vivir honestamente.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas y verduras para vender tanto ella como su esposo. Está en el banco hace 12 ciclos y le gusta porque la ayuda que le da el banco es muy importante para su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales y personas de bien.
texts.en:
The “3 de Mayo” (May 3rd) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  The place is known for being a commercial zone, for its San Pedro and San Pablo traditional celebrations, and for the happiness of its people.

This is where we meet Decsi, age 44.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has six children.  Two of them are adults, and the four younger children go to school.  All of her children still live at home.  Her husband devotes himself to commerce.

Our friend and her husband sell fruits and vegetables.  He sells door to door.  He travels all over the city with his tricycle.  Meanwhile, she sells vegetables from a place that she has in her house.  Her business is small, but it allows her to help her husband with the family expenses.  She works every day from 4:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has had her business for over 15 years.  It is very hard work, but it has given them the means to live honestly.

She will use this new loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her to sell as well as for her husband to sell.  She has been in the bank for 12 cycles.  She likes it for the help the bank gives her.  It is very important for her business.

Her dreams are for her children to become professionals and for them to be good people.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee, de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 03 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, para lo cual esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Aydee, una mujer de principios y valores, menciona que ante la separación mancomunada de su conviviente trato de sobre salir adelante y no se amilano ante ese problema, hoy con una sonrisa despejada cuenta que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar los alimentos para su queridos hijos para luego enrumbar a su trabajo cotidiano que esta en la chacra. Para ella no existe los días de feriado, ya que tienen que trabajar continuamente para tener una buena producción y dar el mejor porvenir a sus queridos hijos. Sus principales productos de siembra son: el cacao, café y frutos de maní, los cuales vende a buenos precios en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que pueden perjudicar su plantas. Para el futuro, planea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus queridos hijos. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también y agradece de ante mano a los financistas ya que esta segura de contar con el apoyo de ellos. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de café, para luego cultivarlas y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos.
texts.en:
Aydee, age 40, ia a hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her three beloved children.  What she wishes for the most is to give them a better quality of life.  In order to do so she is prepared to work very hard.  Aydee is a woman of principles and values.  She says when she faced the separation from her life partner she tried to get ahead.  She did not falter when she faced this problem.

Now with a bright smile she says that she gets up very early every day in order to prepare the food for her beloved children.  Then she heads out for her daily work at the farm.  For her there are no holidays because she has to work continually in order to have a good production and to give her beloved children a better future.

The main products that she grows are cacao, coffee, and peanuts.  She sells them for a good price in the city of San Francisco.  What she likes the most about her work is the freedom that she has working on her crops.  She is able to freely enjoy her green fields.  She has been doing this business activity for 15 years.  She considers the most difficult part to be taking care so that her crops are not are not infested with insects, which could damage her plants.  In the future she plans to buy new land.  With new land she would be able to increase her income and improve her beloved children’s quality of life.

This will be her second loan with MFP.  She has been very punctual with her payments, and she plans to be punctual now as well.  She thanks the lenders ahead of time because she is sure to count on their support.  She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy more coffee seeds to later plant and benefit from their yield.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase scales, products to stock his store, and counters.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando, de 30 años, es un hombre sociable y trabajador, vive en su propia morada situado en la comunidad de Quillabamba. Los verdes campos de la selva tropical, han sido en la vida de Orlando un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora cuenta con sus propias parcelas en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio sus cultivos de cacao, café, frutos de plátano y maní, poseyendo en total 02 hectáreas de terreno. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Lleva 08 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio situado en la ciudad de Quimbiri y San Francisco. Con el crédito solicitado comprará materiales para refaccionar su vivienda. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras para luego heredarlos a sus queridos hijos. Este será su primer crédito de Orlando y esta muy contento de saber que contará con el apoyo de todos ustedes y así progresar gracias al apoyo de ellos. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará materiales de construcción para poder refaccionar su vivienda.
texts.en:
30-year-old Orlando is a sociable and hard-working man who lives in his own home in the community of Quillabamba.  The green fields of the tropical rainforest have been a very pleasant place for Orlando to work throughout his life.  His parents taught him this work when he was very young and now he owns his own plots of land where he works on his cacao, coffee, banana and peanut crops with a lot of care and sacrifice.  He has 2 hectares of land in total.

What Orlando most enjoys about his work is harvesting his land as that is when he feels that the months of hard work are providing their reward in the quality of his fruit.  He has been in this business for eight years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his crops from his community to the storage warehouses in the towns of Quimbiri and San Francisco.

Orlando will use the loan he has requested to buy materials with which to refurbish his home.  Over time, he hopes to be able to put together enough money to buy new land so that he can then leave them to his beloved children as an inheritance.  This will be Orlando's first loan and he is very happy to know that he will have the support of each of you and thereby be able to make progress.  He will use his 3,000 soles to buy building supplies with which to refurbish his home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to improve the infrastructure of his home

loans.name: 3.13.77.thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Sơn is 37 years old and is married with three dependent children. She lives and works in Thiệu Đô district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Sơn works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in future. Sơn has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Sơn faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

Sơn is the group leader of the 3.13.77 Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of seven members. This is Sơn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Sơn hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha, aged 51, is a farmer with her husband and they can earn income of $2 per day. They have two children, one is studying and one is working earning $4 per day. Every month, Sokha has to spend $30 on food, $10 on school fees, $8 on transportation and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for traveling to her field. Her husband also feeds chickens and pigs at home to make more income to support the family. In the future, she wants to repair her house and support her last child to study at the university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to her field

loans.name: Soklav

texts.en:
Soklav is a farmer and her income is $1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and can earn $4 per day. Soklav has seven children: two are studying and four are working in a factory, with an income of $14 per day for all. Every month she has to spend $40 on food, $7 on electricity, $15 on house rent fee, $10 on school fees, $18 on transportation and $16 on other expenses.

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy cows to resell. The reason she wants to buy a cow is because her neighbor sells them for a cheap price so she can buy and resell to get a profit.

In the future, she wants to sell fertilizer and animal food at home if she has enough money. For her children, she wants to support them to study at the university.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice seed to resell

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Kea, 51 years old, is a pharmacist and could earn $5 per day. Her husband is working in the state hospital earning $7.50 per day. They have three children: one is studying and the other two are working, with $3 per day earnings for each. Every month she has to spend $75 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on house rent fee, $10 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $10 on other expenses.

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for use by the family. In the future, she wants to open a clinic for general healing at home.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for use by the family

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea, 27 years old, is a tailor and could earn $3 per day for her income. Her husband is a tok tok (motorcycle-based taxi) driver with $4 per day earnings. This couple does not yet have any children.

Every month she has to spend $30 on food, $3 on electricity, $5 on house rent fee, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a new tok tok for her husband's career. This loan will help her husband to get a new tok tok for doing his job and the income from this career will support her career by allowing her to buy material for doing tailoring.

loans.use: to buy a new tok tok for her husband's career

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal, 58, is a farmer with her husband and their income is $2 a day. They have four children, all of whom work in a factory for $3 a day  each. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on housing rent, $17 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work. In the future, she hopes to be able to repair her house to make it more livable than it is now.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work.

loans.name: Mer

texts.en: Mer, 47, is a cake seller and can earn $4 a day. She is a single mother with three children, all of whom work in a factory for $3 a day each. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on housing rent, $15 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work. Mer used to be a farmer but changed her career to sell cake afT. she take a loan from Kredit MFI. Her new career can provide a good income to her family. In the future, she wants to buy a flat in Phnom Penh and to sell food and cake there.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea, 42, is a farmer with his wife and they potentially earn $3 a day. They have four children - one is studying, two are working in a factory for $3 a day each and one more is staying home. Every month, he has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to launch a motor taxi service to gain income for support his family. In the future, he wants to feed animals and pigs and to buy a cow for resale, when he has enough money. For his children, he wants to support his child who is currently in school to study in the university after he completes high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her motor taxi service.

loans.name: Yet

texts.en: Yet, 49, is a fish seller and can earn $4 a day. Her husband is a fisherman and can earn $5 a day. They have three children, one of whom is studying and two who are working in a factory for $3 a day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a boat with a machine for fishing. Her family has been fishing for about 20 years and the villagers in her village are her customers. In the future, she hopes to send her youngest child to study in university like the others so that he can get a good job.

loans.use: to buy a boat with a machine for fishing.

loans.name: Sokhary

texts.en: Sokhary, 53, is a state teacher, working with her husband in a primary school. Their income is $7 per day. She has two children, both of whom work in Phnom Penh for $5 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on housing rent, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to repair her house. In the future, she wants to feed animals and to farm.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: Tha, 27 year old, resides with her husband in Kompong Chhnang province. They sell palm sugar, and frogs, earning an income of $3 each per day. This couple has four children, and all of them are studying. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fee, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. Tha wants to request a loan of $400 to purchase equipment to expand her business of producing palm sugar. In the future, she hopes to have enough money to rebuild her house to live in a better standard.

loans.use: To buy equipment to expand her business

loans.name: Penh

texts.en: Mrs. Penh, 31, lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province, where she earns a living raising pigs and farming her own farmland. She has been running this business for many years, and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a firewood seller. They are blessed with two children, both of whom are single and living under their care. This couple currently owns a cultivating machine that they use for their farming. In order to create more income, Penh would like to request some funds from HKL and Kiva toward purchasing additional firewood for her husband to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Saren

texts.en: Saren, 38 year old, is making flat baskets to sell with her husband, earning an income of $5 per day. They have three children, one is studying and the other two are working in the factory making $3.50 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $20 on school fees, $6 on transportation, $12 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for the family to use and for her to transport baskets to sell. In the future, she wants to repair her house, and send all of her children to study at least through high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family to use and to sell her baskets.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath, 29 year old, is a hair dresser and can earn an income of $3.50 per day. Her husband buys motorbikes for resale, his income is $3.50 per day. She has three children, two of whom are studying. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $20 on school fees, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy wood and zinc to build a small shop for her career of hair dressing. In the future, she wants want to sell rice and food in front of her hair dresser shop to get more income. For her children, she wants to send them to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy wood and zinc to build a small shop for her business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 49 years old and lives with her spouse, with whom she has five children. They live in their own house, located in the village of San Antonio province of Isabela. Angelita is a courageous woman who has decided to not be afraid of anything. She is ready to do anything to achieve her goals. Before she had this business, she worked in agriculture, cultivating corn and obtained a good income. 

Now she makes her living selling pigs which clearly is not so physically demanding as working in the fields. At present, her beloved husband is the one who cultivates the fields; on occasion, he also assists her. Angelita is pleased with the work that she is doing because it is also a good source of income. Sometimes she must wake up very early to distribute the food to her pigs.

Angelita wants to increase her capital in order to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina Duldulao is from the village of San Antonio, Isabela. She is married and her spouse works as a delivery boy of soft drinks. They have two children: Regine, 18 years old, and Rhena, 10 years old, an elementary student. Gina is a kindhearted person who is always willing to help other people. She is also a responsible mother and diligent business woman. 

Gina sells different kinds of footwear (slippers) for men and women and sometimes she also sells used clothes (ukay-ukay) in their neighborhood. She is hoping to obtain a loan of PHP 20,000 that she can use as additional capital to purchase slippers in bulk and to continue her “ukay-ukay” business. She plans to send her eldest child to college and to take a management course thus, she really needs to work hard to increase her income and help her husband to meet their daily needs. Her retailing business has expanded and she hopes that it will remain strong until her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy slippers in bulk

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatris is 54 years old and a mother of three children. Her eldest daughter is married and operates a grocery store in the market where she sells daily-use items such as cooking oil, can goods, spices and other products. Her behavior with her customers is very good and her prices are also very reasonable; that’s why she has a good number of customers who purchase groceries from her regularly. Her other children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Beatris stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan because her daughter wants to expand her grocery store business. With the loan, she will purchase groceries in bulk quantity which will allow her to fill the needs of her clients and earn more profits. She has been operating her business for the past ten years and Beatris is hopeful that the loan will help her daughter in expanding her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, can goods and other products that her daughter can sell in her store

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a responsible mother who operates a business raising pigs to earn extra income and satisfy her family’s needs. Her spouse works as a farmer. Guillerma and her husband have been raising their family in their village for almost 20 years and they only earn 30,000 PHP profit each harvest season. 

Guillerma is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan to buy pig feed, vitamins, and materials to improve her pig pen. She believes that her hard work will improve her business and make it viable, and she continues to strive despite the hardships and difficulties of life. In the future, Guillerma hopes to improve her business to increase her income and finance the education of her children who are now in college.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 32 years old and is a hardworking mother and a responsible village member. She lives in the village of San Antonio province of Isabela. Her husband is an overseas worker. Maricris opened a grocery ten years ago and she earns 300 PHP daily from her business. 

Maricris is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase snack foods, drinks, cooking oil, spices, and other products that she can offer in her community. She hopes that expanding her business will help her husband provide for the family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, drinks, cooking oil, and spices

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past four years, she has run a business where she buys and sells household goods and ready-to-wear clothing. Her business is in the Philippines.

Alona is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more merchandise to sell. In the future, she would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Imilda

texts.en:
Imilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past 15 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Imilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Imilda is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gunjilmaa

texts.en:
Gunjilmaa is 43 years old. She is married and lives with her family in the outer ger district, an area without basic infrastructure, in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.  Gunjilmaa’s family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent.  Both of her daughters attend secondary school while her elder son works as a driver at local company. 

For the past 10 years, Gunjilmaa has supported her family by operating a retail clothing stall at the largest outdoor market of Mongolia, with help from her husband. She usually sells women’s clothes which are imported from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. Today, her working capital is 3,000,000 MNT. 

Gunjilmaa is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing and increase the range of goods she offers. Gunjilmaa is a responsible client who has repaid previous loans. Her long-term aim is to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old, married, and has two children. 

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell. 

Teresita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from frozen foods. 

Teresita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Marlita has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines, mackerel, & milkfish. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 14,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell. 

Marlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue was born in 1976. She lives in Xom Huong village, Co Loa commune. She is married with two children. Her husband is a driver, and she has a general store. 

She has a participated in SEDA since 2004. The last time, she borrowed 8,066,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). This time, she would like to borrow 9,374,000 VND to invest in her general store(to buy more chairs, tables, goods,et).

loans.use: to invest in her general store(to buy more chairs, tables, goods,et).

loans.name: Karen Rose

texts.en:
Karen Rose is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Karen Rose has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods, beverages & breads. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Karen Rose has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Karen Rose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 51 years old and married with two children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling "nipa" (palm fronds used for housing material) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of "nipa" to sell.

Alicia has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the "nipa" business for 7 years and also earns an income from ready-to-wear.

Alicia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of "nipa"  to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Emelda has a retail shop that sells motor oil, fuel, kerosene & gasoline per liter. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy gallons of gasoline & fuel to sell.

Emelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gallons of gasoline & fuel to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luna

texts.en:
Ma. Luna is 47 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Luna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying & selling "nipa" (palm fronds used as building material) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for "nipa" mat making.

Ma. Luna has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying & selling "nipa" for 10 years and also earns an income from sari-sari (variety) store.

Ma. Luna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for "nipa" mat making.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
Melina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Melina has a shop that sells snacks, fish paste, milk & chocolate powdered drinks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Melina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Melina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong was born in 1971. She lives in Xom Huong village. She is married with three children. Her main job is farming. She not only grows rice but also she and her husband make cakes from rice. (The Vietnamese call it Banh Da.) They have had this job for many years. 

Phuong has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). The last time she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,374,000 VND to buy rice to make pancakes.

loans.use: to buy rice to make pancakes.

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en:
Emmalinda is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Emmalinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & a variety of beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy snacks, canned goods, breads & beverages to sell.

Emmalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emmalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods, breads & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Khatanbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Khatanbaatar, 23, is a taxi driver and lives with his wife in a rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They married just this year and trying to solve the problems of a young family. He has been running a taxi business since 2009 and his daily earnings are not enough for his life. His wife used to work as a sales manager in a company, but she became unemployed after the world economic crises in 2009. Now the taxi business is the main income source of this family. 

Khatanbaatar has a plan to furnish and make adjustments to his rental apartment. But he lacks money for some furniture and building materials for repair. Therefore he is taking a loan to use as an additional funding for purchasing the building materials and some furniture to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To have additional funding to purchase building materials and some furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electronic loads to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Rebecca has a shop that sells canned goods, detergents, snacks & noodles. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, detergents & noodles to sell.

Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents & noodles to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Rosalina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Gracelda

texts.en:
Gracelda is 47 years old and lives in Canal, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married and has four children.

Gracelda engaged in food vending business to earn a living. She earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for school tuition and miscellaneous school fees.

Gracelda has been a member of PMPC for 10 months. In the future, she hopes, her children will finished their courses and land good jobs for greener pastures.

loans.use: to pay for school tuition and miscellaneous school fees

loans.name: Bazarragchaa

texts.en:
Bazarragchaa, 51, is a welder who lives with his two children and wife in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

For many years, he worked as a welder in state organizations, and in 2001, he started his own private welding business with his two followers. He often had a high work load and took many orders from customers every day.
  
Recently, his eyesight has became very bad due to working many years as a welder, which is a very unhealthful job, and it is impossible to continue his job further. But it was a main source of his family's income.
 
Therefore, he and his wife are planning to start another private business as vegetable growers. It is a more nature-oriented activity than welding.

Bazarragchaa has tested planting some vegetables near his house and it was done successfully, so he can grow some kind of vegetables in the last part of summer. 

Now he needs only a small grocery store to sell his vegetables near home, because already he has customers around the district. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to buying some building materials to build a grocery store beside his home to sell his own vegetables.

loans.use: To buy building materials to build a store to sell his vegetables.

loans.name: Erdenedalai

texts.en:
Erdenedalai is a 27-year-old entrepreneur who owns one small stall at the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He is the father of two children, age 1 and 3, and his mother babysits while his spouse helps him with the business. 

Erdenedalai has been operating a clothing sales business at the market since 2002 when he first rented his stall. Today, his working capital is approximately two million MNT. With his business profit, he has bought a small land plot located in the outer ger district (which has no basic infrastructure) and furnishing goods. 

Erdenedalai is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to import more women clothes from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. 

In the future, he desires to build a new house on his plot of land.

loans.use: to import more clothes from Ereen, a border city of China.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 34 years old and lives in Lower Langcangan. She is married and has two children. 

Jane has two motorcycles with sidecars as her business and earns approximately PHP 8,100 each month doing this type of work. 

She has  requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase wheel for her motorcycle sidecars  transport business.
 
Jane has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Jane hopes to have an additional motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase wheel for her motorcycle with side cars transport business.

loans.name: Relita

texts.en:
Relita is married and has 12 children. Relita is 62 years old and lives in Malibacsan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Relita sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy groceries and supplies to sell to customers of her convenience store. 

Relita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Relita hopes to earn more profit from her business to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and supplies to sell to customers of her convenience store

loans.name: Jesee

texts.en:
Jesee is married to Mary and they have three children.

Jesee was introduced to KADET Ltd. through existing clients and is taking his first loan, He has been in the hotel business for one year now, and he makes a monthly income of KES 8,000. Jesee will use the loan to purchase more hotel utensils such as a grill, cooking pots and a big charcoal stove. (In Africa, "hotel" often means a small restaurant, not a place to sleep.)

Jesee will use the profits to expand his business and buy more hotel assets and also support the family. He hopes to get more experience and in the long run to open a chain of hotels.

loans.use: to purchase restaurant utensils such as a grill and cooking pots.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 42 years old and lives in Labakid, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has five children.

Adelfa sells firewood in any other barangays (villages) in the community to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 4,800 PHP doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase bananas and fish to sell.

Adelfa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Adelfa hope to make her business grow and help her children to finish their studies by supporting them financially.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings and prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa was born in 1957. She is single. She lives in Xom Huong village, Co Loa commune. Her one leg was disabled. So her life is very hard.

She has a general store at home. Her main job is as a cobbler. Besides this, she also knits sweaters, wool hats and wool scarves to sell. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND. 

She has participated in SEDA since 2004 and always repaid loans punctually. This is the eighth time she is borrowing money from SEDA. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy goods to sell and wool for knitting.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell and wool for knitting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wheat flour and finish the house.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a forty-three-year-old married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been taking care of the family with the help of his wife, and their dream is to set up sustainable income generating activities for the family. 

He has been in the poultry business for four years and in the transport business for ten years. His hardship is high fuel prices, and his vision is to have about three taxis plus 3,000 birds in the next three years. Johnson needs the loan to repair his taxi.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai was born in 1973. She lives in Xom Huong village, Co Loa commune. She is married and has three children who are still small. Her husband is a carpenter. He has an income of about 3,000,000 VND. Mrs. Mai has a general store. She sells everything for everybody in her village. She has a daily income of about 100,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2005. Her last loan was for 6,322,000 VND, and she repaid the loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to repair her store.

loans.use: to repair her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To brew alcohol.

loans.name: 03.11.79 Thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tám has a retail business selling stationery items. She is requesting a loan to purchase school supplies for children. Tám is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She is the group leader of the 03.11.79 Thiệu D. solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Tám joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tám has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tám  has been involved in her business for four years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Tám hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. She wants her family to be healthy and happy, and her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and wheat and maize seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction tools and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell and chemicals to make detergent

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy is 45 years old and is married to local farmer. They live together in Dalaoig, Alcala. The couple was blessed with two children, both of whom are attending secondary school. For almost ten years, Precy and her husband have cultivated a one-hectare rice field. 

Precy does not have sufficient funds to sustain her farm and therefore she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pay labor costs to cultivate the land. This loan will enable her to sustain her crop. During the previous harvest season in May, Precy and her family earned about 40,000 PHP which went to pay school fees and buy groceries for daily meals.

In the future, Precy would like to earn consistent profits and save for the college education of her two children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and hire field labor

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is engaged in agriculture. She has been successfully running the business for the past fifteen years, through which she managed to build a barn. Laura would like to develop her farming more and increase her daily income. 

With the requested loan Laura plans to purchase calves. The development of her farming and the additional income it provides will allow Laura to renovate her old house and improve her family's living conditions. Laura lives together with her son.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking mother. She doesn't want to laze about at home. She has had a farming business for almost 13 years. They plant and harvest rice for future sale. She has helped her husband in maintaining their farming business. She wants to improve her crop production and generate more income in order to sustain the education of her only daughter, who might also need money for daily expenses. During the crop season in May, she usually earns about 35,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). 

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to have additional revolving capital to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. 

Edna aims to continuously produce an abundant harvest to earn enough money for the college education of her child. She would like to provide a better education for her child, leading  someday to good employment, and in that way help her improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
This is Samson, age 28. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past four years. He is a good client. He applied for his first loan with KADET which he plans to use to purchase farm supplies. 

He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farming. He dreams of prospering in his farming activities in order to provide better lives for his children. He can do more despite limited resources.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 29 years old, married, and blessed with one child. She sells second-hand jackets to the resident of Kasarani, Nairobi, Kenya. She has been in this kind of business for the last two years and gets an income of KES 8,800 per month.

Jane is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD with which she plans to buy stocks of clothes for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to buy household items and improve her business.

Jane hopes to expand her business, rent a shop, and become a supplier of second hand clothes in bails. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To add stock for sale.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a flexible person. She is determined to generate income for the daily sustenance of her family. Aside from raising hogs, she also involved herself in the farming business together with her husband. They both plant and harvest rice and sell it to traders when they harvest. According to her, profits earned were not enough to sustain all their needs, especially for the education of her only child who they send to college. 

Fe is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides used in farming. Through the help of this loan, she will improve her crop production and generate more income.

She hopes to continue the education of her child in order to achieve good employment someday to experience a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides used in farming.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 51 years-old and married with 4 children.

Ninfa works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells Avon products in the Philippines and requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock.

Ninfa has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been buying & selling Avon products for 4 years and also earns an income from sari-sari storing.

Ninfa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon products to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Efrenor

texts.en:
Efrenor describes himself as an ambitious person. He keeps dreaming for a better quality of life someday. Aside from his hog raising business, he works hard all day long in his rice field. He cultivates a half-hectare plot of land. He plants and harvests rice and sells it to local traders in the village where he lives together with his wife and three children. He earned about 30,000 PHP during the last cropping season in May and used it for paying electric bills, grocery items for daily meals and allowances for his children.

Efrenor is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP because he has insufficient capital to buy seeds and herbicides (chemicals used to kill growth of unwanted plants like weeds that affect growth of seedlings) necessary in farming.

Efrenor would like to continuously harvest abundant crops to save enough money in preparation for the college education of his three children. He wants them to have a degree and good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy seeds and herbicides used in farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another public service vehicle which will increase his income.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married to Olpha and they have one child. Peter was introduced to KADET through existing clients and he is servicing his first loan.

Peter has been in the business of owning a barber shop and beauty salon for one year now,  Olpha supports him in handling the business, and from the business Peter makes an income of KES 22,000 per month. The loan shall be used to purchase a shaving machine.

With the profits, Peter shall improve the living standards of his family. Peter hopes to have an executive barber shop and beauty salon as he is hardworking and focused.

loans.use: to purchase a shaving machine

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit and vegetables for her fruit and vegetable vending business.

Jesusa has been in this business for nine years. Jesusa earns more income from buying and selling charcoal and firewood and pig fattening.

Jesusa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, and maize meal to add to her shop inventory.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita works hard to support her family. Merlita is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish (boneless "danguit") in the Philippines.

Merlita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. She has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Merlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats and bulls for slaughtering and dried maize and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to her stock of apples, oranges and lemons for sale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old and married with three children.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, and requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Helen has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from a coffee shop.

Helen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari (general) store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an oven that will help him increase his income.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 37 years old and married with two children.

Mary Jean works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Mary Jean has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years, and she also earns an income from rice retailing.

Mary Jean aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 31 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rodelyn is borrowing 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rodelyn has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jellingson

texts.en:
Jellingson is married to Muraa and they have three children.

Jelligson was introduced to KADET LTD through existing clients; he is servicing his first loan. He has been in the construction and charcoal business for 30 years. He makes a monthly income of 26,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He will use the loan to purchase one container of charcoal.

Jellingson will use the profits to establish his business; thus, he is able to make loan repayments. He hopes to be a wholesale charcoal dealer.

loans.use: To add stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 38 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Yolanda works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Yolanda has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, candies, bread, noodles, beverages, sugar and other groceries. 

Yolanda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 47 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

Rosario works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 23 years. She has requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase three boxes of fish to retail.

Rosario has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosario hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 27-year-old married man with three children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Robert sells used clothes to earn a living and has been in this business for five years. The major hardship encountered is inadequate capital to buy what his clients demand and his dream is a big boutique with both men and women's wear. Robert intends to use the loan facility to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy three bales of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 45 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children.
Editha works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 3,000 Philippine Pesos to purchase one box of fish to sell.
Editha has been a member of PMPC since this year, 2011. In the future, Editha hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase one box of fish to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been practicing dairy farming for the last 16 years in Kiambu town. He is 55 years old and married to Grace. They have six children.

He was introduced to KADET  LTD by a KADET staff member. He has paid the other loans well and in good time. He intends to use this loan amount to expand his milk bar shop where he sells milk produced from his dairy cow.

In future, Peter hopes to practice large scale dairy agriculture.

loans.use: to expand his milk bar shop where he sells milk produced from his dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint and wood for making curios.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao, 52 years old, is a fish seller with her husband. Their income is $7 per day. The couple has six children. Two children are studying and the other two are working, and the $7 per day provides for them for all. Every month, Mao has to spend $60 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 buy a motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi service. She has been selling fish for almost 10 years and most of the villagers are her customers. She hopes that her husband's new career will help her family to gain more income, so that this couple will be able to send the rest of their children to study at a higher level.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband so he can start a motorbike taxi service

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a 43-year-old married man living in his own house in Masindi, Uganda. He has three children, two of whom are attending school. He cuts grass in peoples' compounds for a living and sometimes hires out the machine.

Hardships in the business is working for someone and they don't pay or delay in payment. His dream is to have at least five machines and also to buy land. Mario needs the money to buy a machine since the demand is high.

loans.use: To buy another new mowing machine to meet the demand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for farm labour.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda, 42 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is an electronics repairer with an income of $15 per day.  Her husband teaches electronics repair  to get  additional income. This couple has five children and all of them are studying.  Every month, Chenda has to spend $80 on food, $10 on electricity, $50 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy electronic spare parts for her husband's business.  In the future, Chenda's husband wants to expand his career and teach more students. Chenda wants her children to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy electronic spare parts for her husband's business

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Pon, is a housewife. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, who earns an income of $6 per day. This couple has three children, all of them are working in the factory with the income of $8 per day for all. Every month, Pon has to spend $110 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy wood for rebuild her house. In the future, she wants to have a small tailoring shop at her house for her daughters so that they don’t have to traveling to work so far from home.

loans.use: To buy wood to rebuild her house

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has two children.

Ali has been the owner of a store selling all kinds of grains since 2000. He has good experience in this field, a good reputation and well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan to make a sliding door and to purchase additional inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Nelly Edwige

texts.fr:
Cliente âgé de 29 ans, marié mère d’un enfant.
Vendeuse des sandales dames depuis 12 ans dans un marché de la place.
Ses ventes journalières sont considérables ; elle vend en moyenne 25 000 à 50 000 F CFA par jour. 
A l’octroi de ce crédit ; elle va renforcer son stock en achetant : des sandales dames, hommes et enfants en gros.
Son bon accueil et sa gentillesse sont ses atouts pour la croissance de sa clientèle.
Avec les bénéfices de  son activité, elle compte épargner et à la longue devenir fournisseur des sandales en gros et aussi ouvrir un salon de coiffure.
Comme une bonne mère de famille elle pense acheter une parcelle pour sa famille.
texts.en:
This client is 29 years old and married with one child.
She has been a sandal saleswoman for 12 years at a local market.
Her daily sales are considerable; she makes on average 25 000 to 50 000 F CFA  per day.
Upon  assignment of her credit; she will increase her stock by purchasing: ladies, men’s and children’s sandals wholesale.
Her warm welcome and her kindness are her assets for the growth of her clientele.
With the profits from her business, she intends to save up and in the long term become a wholesale sandal supplier and also open a hairdressing salon.
As any good mother she hopes to purchase a plot of land for her family.

loans.use: Purchase ladies sandals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fish and a new weighing scale

loans.name: Sokouen

texts.en: Sokouen, 51 year old, is a weaver. Her husband used to be a policeman but now he is retired. This couple can earn the income of $7 per day. They have three children, all of whom are working in the factory with an income of $3 per day for each. Every month, Sokouen has to spend $83 on food, $12 on electricity, $18 on transportation, and $25 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for use in the family and to transport weaving products to sell.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 57 years old, married and has three children, all of whom work.

In 2001, Hussein opened his own shop, selling and fixing sanitary and installation materials. He has more than 15 years experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy installation supplies. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy installation supplies.

loans.name: Velmora

texts.en:
Velmora is 31 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 1 child.
Velmora has had a sari-sari store for 3 years. Each month, she earns 10000PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 30000PHP to purchase more stock of  groceries to sell.

Velmora has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Velmora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of  groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood and brick for repairing her son's house.

loans.name: Rovilyn

texts.en:
Rovilyn is married with 1 child. Rovilyn is 27 years old and lives in Cabangcalan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Rovilyn sells jewelry to earn a living and has had this retail business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 3000PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 8000PHP to purchase jewelry to sell.

Rovilyn has been a member of PMPC for than 1 year. In the future, Rovilyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Thai, 31 years old, is a garment factory worker, earning the income of $3 per day. Her husband is also working in the factory with the income of $3 per day. This couple has one child who is four years old. They live with two other family members, Thai's mother and sister. Every month, Thai has to spend $82 on food, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. In the future, she wants to buy grocery goods to sell in front of her house to make more income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Yeoun

texts.en: Yeoun, 46 years old, sells vegetables and rice with her husband. Their income is $6 per day. This couple have two children. One is working in the factory with the income of $3 per day. Every month Yeoun has to spend $82 on food, and $20 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a stock of rice seed for resale in the dry season. In the future, Yeoun wants to buy grocery goods to sell at home so that she could make more income.

loans.use: To buy a stock of rice seed for resale

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun, 37 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a farmer, earning the income of $2 per day. They have four children; two are studying, and two more are working in the factory with $5 per day in income for all. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $9 on electricity, $6 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for farming. This couple does not want to change their career, and they enjoy doing farming. In the future, she only wants to support the rest of her children to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Porn

texts.en: Porn, 49 years old, sells palm fruit and food, earning the income of $3 per day. She is a single mother who lives with four children. One is studying and the other three are working in the factory earning $3 per day for each. Every month, Porn has to spend $70 on food, $12 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy material for repairing her house. She plans to buy a stock of rice for resale when there is a good price.

loans.use: To buy material for repairing her house

loans.name: Dara

texts.en: Dara, 31 years old, is a chief of construction workers with the income of $6.5 per day. His wife is a tailor with the income of $2.5 per day. This couple has three children, none of them studying because they are not yet ready for school. Every month, Dara has to spend $60 on food, $8 on electricity, and $20 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $500 to buy construction equipment for his business. When his career is running well and he increases his good income, he would be able to help his wife  buy fabric for sewing. In the future, Dara hopes that all of his children will get a good education and have  good jobs to do to support themselves.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment for his business

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa was born in 1967. She lives in Luc Canh village. She has two children. She and her husband are farmers. They not only grow rice but she sells vegetables in the market. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Since 2006, she has participated in SEDA. The last time, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha, 54 years old, is a construction worker who earns $5 per day. His wife stays home to take care of the children. This couple has four children. Three are working in the factory for $2 each per day. Every month, he has to spend $50 on food, and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy wood to repair his house. In the future he hopes to have a good house to live in with his family. He does not want to change his career.

loans.use: To buy wood to repair his house

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
Фарход родился 1973 году. Он честный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и отец 4 детей. Его жена не работает, она домохозяйка и присматривает за детьми. Фарход занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, а также купля продажей овощи и фрукты. Займ, который он получил от Имон Интернэшнл раньше, дал ему хороший результат. Он увеличил свой оборотный капитал, получил хороший урожай и улучшил свое условия жизни. Фарход хотел бы получит кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки минеральных удобрений, который позволит ему, получит хороший урожай. Он также хочет использовать займ для покупки семена и оплата труда работникам. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
