Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Farhod was born in 1973.  He is an honest and goal-oriented person.  He is married and is a father of four children.  His wife does not work; she is a homemaker and looks after the children.  Farhod is involved in growing agricultural crops and also buying and selling vegetables and fruits.  His previous loan from Imon International provided him with a good result.  He increased his turnover, gathered a good harvest and improved his quality of life.  Farhod wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of mineral fertilizers, which would allow him to get a good harvest.  He also wants to use the loan for the purchase of seeds and payment of worker wages.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and pay wages to workers

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin was born in 1978. She lives in Luc Canh village which is in the Xuan Canh commune.  She lives with her husband and a child. Her husband is a mechanic. He has income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND) per month. Chin is a tailor. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. Since 2006 she has participated in SEDA and has always repaid her loans punctually. The last time she borrowed 8,502,000 VND. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy cloth and a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy cloth and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 45 years old, married and blessed with six children in school.  She operates a retail shop selling spare parts.  She was not available to have the photo take at the business, so her husband is in the photo.
Margaret says that she has gained a lot of knowledge on how to run her business through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya.  Her dream is to stock her shop so as to meet her customers' demand and grow her business.  She has requested for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more vehicles' spare parts. (Margaret runs the business with her husband, she was not available to be taken a photo hence the husband photo was taken.)

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Erickson

texts.en:
For the last four years Erickson has been operating a curio shop in West Gate, in the town of Westlands. He is 25 years old and is married to Evelyn.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. This will be his first loan. He intends to use the loan to buy ready made African curios which he will later sell at a profit.

In future Erickson hopes to expand his business and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy ready-made African curios which he will later sell at a profit.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en: Jared is a hardworking business man. He is 23 years old and he is married. For the last 7 years, he has been selling shoes to earn a living. In the next 5 years, he wants to manage a wholesale business.  He is requesting for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Najmuddin

texts.ru:
Нажмуддин очень трудолюбивый и добрый человек. У него очень большая семья, их в семье 9 человек: он, его жена и 7 детей, для содержания своей семьи ему нужен стабильный доход и он хочет, чтобы он мог обеспечить и содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. Более 4 года он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он выращивает лук, морковь и картофель. А также он занимается садоводством на своем регионе. Нажмуддин хотел бы получит кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки минеральных удобрений и семена с целью расширения бизнеса и получение прибыли. Заранее он хочет благодарит всех вас за вашу поддержку и помощь. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Najmuddin is a hard-working and kind person.  He has a very large family - there are nine people in his family: he, his wife and seven children.  He needs a stable income in order to support his family, and he wants to support and provide good quality of life for them.  Najmuddin has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over 4 years.  He grows onions, carrots and potatoes.  He is also involved in gardening in his region.  Najmuddin wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and seeds in order to expand his business and make a profit.  He thanks all of you in advance for your support and help.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Joanes

texts.en:
Joanes is 43 years old, married and has four children.  To earn a living, he sells fish.  He has been in the business for 13 years.  He has managed to retain his business because of his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  He also employs two people in his business.
Joanes hopes to grow his business into a wholesale operation in the future.  He has requested for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy fish.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of maize for resale

loans.name: Siraji

texts.en:
Siraji is 46 years old and married with five children. Four of them are attending school and living in his house in Masindi, Uganda. His family goal is for his children to obtain higher levels of education. Siraji is a taxi driver and has been in the transportation sector for eight years.
He started by driving in the Ministry of Defense, but later realized that he could make more money driving his own car. With his savings, he bought a small car (a Starlet) which works as a taxi. A hardships in the business is high traffic fees. His dream is to buy a mini bus. The purpose of the loan is to service and repair his vehicle which is in poor mechanical condition.

loans.use: To service and repair his vehicle which is in poor mechanical condition.

loans.name: Kidindimya Tweyambe Group

texts.en: Mary is a member of the Kidindimya Tweyambe group. In this group, each member guarantees one another in accessing a loan. Mary lives in her own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is 31 years old and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children since her husband has no job. She dreams of educating her children. For four years she has been rearing cattle. In a day she earns 10000 from milk sales. Her hardship is low output during the dry season. Her dream is to have at least 30 cows. Mary intends to buy cows with the loan.

loans.use: to buy cows for rearing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, and rice and also to bake bread

loans.name: Amurllo

texts.ru:
Амурлло женат и любящий отец 4 детей. Он четный, трудолюбивый и добрый человек.   Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он выращивает почти все виды овощи. Когда ему было 34 лет он начал этот бизнес и продолжает это. Таким путем он зарабатывает денег на содержание свою семью. Его супруга и брат помогает ему по посеву семена и переработки земли. Амурлло хотел бы получит займ в размере 7000 Сомони для покупки горюче смазочные материалы, минеральных удобрений и семена. Он заранее хочет, благодарит всех кредиторов за их поддержку и поощрение.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Amurllo is married and is a loving father of four children.  He is an honest, hard-working and kind person.  He is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He grows almost all types of vegetables.  Amurllo started this business when he was 34 years old and continues it now.  This is how he earns money to support his family.  His wife and brother help him with planting seeds and treating land.  Amurllo wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 7000 Somoni for the purchase of fuel and lubricants, mineral fertilizers and seeds.  He wants to thank all creditors in advance for the support and help.

loans.use: to buy fuels and lubricants, mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes to sell

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
For the last nine years, Serah has been selling cereals in the town of Oloitoktok. She is 32 years old and is married to Peter. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to add to her stock of beans, ground nuts and maize for sale.

In future Serah hopes to own land that she may cultivate.

loans.use: to add beans, ground nuts and maize to sell

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Enkhbold is 43 years old. He is a herder who feeds a number of cows and calves on his small farm. He lives with his son, daughter and wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Darkhan. Darkhan is the second largest city in Mongolia. Since 1976, he has been raising livestock and he has gained good experience. 
He keeps his cows' milk in a big freezer and sells it to the grocery stores which are located near his farm. Recently his freezer has broken and has not been keeping the milk safe. It is a critical problem for a farmer and he needs to solve it immediately.  
Therefore he is planning to buy a new stable freezer which can keep the milk safely. He needs the support of a loan to cover its cost. Enkhbold is taking a loan to buy a new freezer to keep his cows' milk frozen.

loans.use: To buy a new freezer to keep his cows' milk frozen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, onions and carrots.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been farming for the last 10 years in the town of Oloitoktok. She is 34 years old and is married to Christopher. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

In the future, Grace hopes to build rental houses which will generate additional income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and beans.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been selling clothes for the last two years in the town of Oloitoktok. She is 41 years old and is married to Zachariah. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan to buy trousers, skirts and T-shirts.

In the future, Grace hopes to own land in the town of Oloitoktok.

loans.use: to buy trousers, skirts and T-shirts.

loans.name: Oyunbaatar

texts.en:
Oyunbaatar is 46 years old and retired from the army. He lives with his 4 kids and wife in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Previously he was in the Mongolian Border Force, but he retired early. For the last month, he has been working as a bus driver for a secondary school.  
In 2008 he started to build a small house within his fence. He could not finish it due to the lack of money. Recently he completed the building of part of his house and he needs additional money to finish it before the winter. Therefore he is taking a loan to purchase some building materials to finish the house.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to finish the building his house.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
For the last four years Jane has been selling kerosene in the town of Ndumberi,Kiambu. She is 40 years old and a single mother of four children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. She has paid her other loans well and on time. She intends to use the loan amount to increase her stock of kerosene.

In the future, Jane hopes to open another kerosene selling business in the town of Kiambu.

loans.use: to increase her stock of kerosene.

loans.name: Lkhamkhuu

texts.en:
Lkhamkhuu is 39 years old.  She is a clothing seller and lives with her 3 daughters in a leased apartment in Darkhan. Darkhan is the second largest city in Mongolia. Her husband Battsengel has been working as a blacksmith in a steel mill in Korea in order to earn more money over the last 4 years. 

Lkhamkhuu sells clothes at the bazaar and imports commodities from abroad. Since one of her daughters became a student she has begun facing difficulties running her business due to a lack of funds.

She is requesting a loan to raise her income by increasing her working capital to sell more clothes to her customers.

loans.use: To raise her income by increasing her working capital to sell more clothes to her customers.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 60 years old, married, and a father of one child aged 18 years. He has been operating a hotel as a primary business and a retail shop as a secondary business for the past ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 24,000 which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying his third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Stephen will use the loan to buy sugar, wheat flour, rice and maize meal for both businesses. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant which will help him support his family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat flour, rice and maize meal for his two businesses

loans.name: Mishnel Hervins

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 26 ans , marié père d’un enfant.N’ayant pas de soutient pour poursuivre ses études universitaires , il se lance dans le commerce des CD, cassettes et DVD, ses 
ventes sont considérables , il vend en moyenne 10 000 à 40 000 F Cfa par jour.
A l’octroie de ce crédit , il va renforcer son commerce en achetant :des lots de CD , des dvd, des cassettes et un graveur des CD
Avec les bénéfices de son commerce, il pense épargner et à la longue élargir son activité en ouvrant une discotheque, Comme un bon père de famille , il pense financer les études de ses enfants et construire une maison  dans sa parcelle.
texts.en:
Mishnel Hervins is 26 years old, married and has one child. As he did not have the funds he needed to be able to continue with his university education, he started a business selling CDs, cassettes, and DVDs. His sales are high and he earns between 10 000 and 40 000 francs a day.
Mishnel Hervins will use this loan to reinforce his business activities by restocking on CDs, DVDs and cassettes, and buying a CD-writer. As a good father, he wants to be able to cover his children´s educational expenses, and build a house on his plot of land. He also plans to save some of the profits from his business so that he can eventually open a club.

loans.use: to buy cassettes, CDs, DVDs and a CD-writer.

loans.name: Erdenemunkh

texts.en:
Erdenemunkh is 24 years old and lives with his wife and daughter on his own small sized land located in the Darkhan city of Mongolia. He is a truck farmer and cultivates vegetables in 2 plant-houses behind his house. Also he and his wife both work in a wool factory. 
Erdenemunkh uses his own grown vegetables in private needs and sells the remaining vegetables outside of his family.  This covers the most part of his income and he is planning to add another plant-house in his vegetable garden. It is a natural-oriented businesses. Therefore he is taking a loan to cover a plant-house cost. Before he had taken loans 2 times and successfully repaid them on time.

loans.use: To covers a plant-house cost.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 41 years old, he is married to Esther who is a farmer. They are blessed with one child aged 12 years old. He has been a carpenter for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 30,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. David will use the loan to buy timber and expand the business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. His hopes are to open a hotel which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy timber and expand the business.

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron is 24 years old and a business man, he is married to Tabitha who is a house wife. They have no children by now. He has been running a retail shop for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 7,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Haron will use the loan to buy sugar, wheat flour, and maize meal to add to his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his shop. His hopes are to open a wholesale shop which will cater for his coming children.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat flour, and maize meal to add to his shop

loans.name: Marub

texts.ru:
Маруб умный и добрый человек. Он женат и у них 5 детей. Он занимается купля продажей скота. Он начал свой бизнес с разведением овца. Данный бизнес приносит ему хороший доход, и он хочет расширить этот бизнес. Прибыль, который он получил от данного бизнеса, дал ему возможность проводит свадебных мероприятий и покрыт семейные расходы. В данный момент он имеет 4 голов коров и 3 голов барана. Маруб хотел бы получит займ для покупки скота, с целью расширения бизнеса.      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Marub is a smart and kind person.  He is married and has five children.  He is involved in buying and selling livestock.  He started his business with breeding sheep.  The current business brings him a good income, and he wants to expand this business.  The profits from this business gave him an opportunity to hold weddings and cover family expenses.  Currently, he has four cows and three sheep.  Marub wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of livestock in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and expand his business

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en:
Aida is the treasurer of this group. She is 35 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she brings up two daughters and a son. The son works in the brick factory, the older daughter is at school and the second daughter is not yet, she is preschool age (under seven). Two years ago with an initial investment of 5000 soms Aida and her husband started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening earns the family about 3000 soms per month. This profit made it possible to improve the living conditions and to repair the house. With money received from the loan Aida wants to purchase four livestock animals for breeding, fattening and further reselling. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats for sale to increase his income.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija is a business woman aged 49. She is married and blessed with three children. For the last 4 years, she has been selling cushions and curtains to earn a living. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting for a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy curtains. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become more business oriented.

loans.use: To buy curtains

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is single. He offers transportation to the residents of Tala, Kenya. He has been in this business for the last seven years and gets an income of KES.15,000 per month.

Simon has got good credit history in KADET and he is applying for his fifth loan of KES.50,000 from KADET LTD which he plans to purchase another motor bike.He will use the anticipated profit to save and diversify his business.

Simon hopes to own a matatu. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy a motor bike.

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 34 ans, célibataire et père d’un enfant, n’ayant pas de soutien pour poursuivre ses études universitaires, il se lance dans la coiffure et fait son apprentissage auprès d’une école de la place.
Il ouvre son salon de coiffure depuis une année.Il a des recettes de  5000 à 15 000 F CFA par jour.
A l’octroi de son crédit, il va refectionner son salon en achetant de la peinture pour repeindre les murs et il va aussi  renforcer son commerce en achetant : un miroir, un groupe électrogène pour alimenter son salon et  coiffer ses clients en cas de frequentes coupres d'electricite.
Avec les bénéfices de son activité, il compte épargner  et à la longue élargir son activité en ouvrant un autre salon de coiffure.
Comme un bon père de famille, il pense acheter un terrain pour sa famille et la construire.
texts.en: Michel is a 34 year old single father of one who began to work in the hair salon business after not having enough money to pursue higher education. After learning the trade in a nearby school, he opened his own hair salon one year ago. He currently received daily earnings of between 5000 and 15,000 FCFA (approximately 10 to 30 USD). He is asking for a loan in order to update his salon by re-painting the walls, purchase a mirror, and a small generator to enable him to continue serving clients despite frequent power outtages.With the profits from his business, he hopes to continue saving money and in the future, open a second hair salon location. He also hopes to purchase land and build a home for his family.

loans.use: update his salon with new wall paint, mirrors, scissors and a small generator

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a determined business man aged 29. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last 4 years, he has been operating a business of making  metallic doors and gates to make a living. Previously, he was involved with a business of selling plastic items such as water containers, cups and basins. In the next 5 years, he wants to grow his business. He is requesting for a loan of 60,000 to buy a welding machine. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more aggressive in his business.

loans.use: To buy welding machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Alfayo

texts.en: Alfayo is a businessman who is 30 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last two years, he has been selling clothes to earn a living. He has employed two people to help him manage his business. In the next five years, he wants to transform his business into a boutique. His dream is to open an electronics shop. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ibod

texts.ru:
Ибод умный, добрый и целеустремленный человек. Он вдовец и у него 10 детей. Ему тяжело содержать свою семью одному, и он всегда нуждается в помощи. Более 10 лет Ибод занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур, а также откормом крупного рогатого скота. Так как у него очень большая семья ему нужен хороший доход, чтобы обеспечить своих детей, и поэтому он  хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль, чтобы его дети выросли в хороших условиях. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 2500$ США для покупки семена и пополнение оборотного капитала. Ибод хочет заранее благодарит всех за помощь и поддержку.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Ibod is a smart, kind and goal-oriented person.  He is a widower and has ten children.  It is hard for him to support his family alone, and he always needs help.  Ibod has been involved in growing agricultural crops and raising cattle for over 10 years.  Because he has such a large family, he needs to have a good income in order to provide for his children.  This is why he wants to expand his business and maximize his profits, so that his children could grow up in good conditions.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2500 for the purchase of seeds and replenishment of his working capital.  Ibod wants to thank everyone for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and replenish working capital

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru:
Бурулкан родилась в селе Беловодском (Московский район, Кыргызская Республика) в многодетной малообеспеченной семье животновода (11 детей). По окончании 9 классов сельской школы поступила в строительный техникум, в котором отучилась 3 года. С детства Бурулкан помогала родителям по хозяйству, присматривала за младшими детьми и параллельно ухаживала за скотом.
В возрасте 20 лет её выдали замуж. Первое время Бурулкан с мужем жили у его родителей в селе Беловодском. Через год после свадьбы у них рождается первый сын, а через два года второй. В 1993 году, поднакопив немного денег, Бурулкан с супругом покупают дом в селе Петровка (Московский район, Кыргызская республика (7 км от Беловодска) и дойную корову. В 1996 году у них рождается дочь. К этому моменту в их хозяйстве насчитывается две дойных коровы и два бычка.
В 2002 году Бурулкан с супругом, продав дом в селе Петровка и часть скота, покупают небольшой дом в городе Карабалта. Супруг устраивается на работу в спортивную школу детским тренером по футболу, где и работает по сей день. На тот момент у них была одна телочка и бычок. Через некоторое время телочка стала дойной коровой, а бычка пришлось продать, для того что бы купить молодых телочек.
В 2005 году Бурулкан женила старшего сына, и для этого пришлось распродать часть скота. В данное время старший сын со своей женой живут и работают в России и помогают своим родителям деньгами, а их сын живет с Бурулкан. В данное время у Бурулкан нет скота, так как они с мужем построили новый забор из пескоблока, поставили новые металлические ворота и построили новый сарай на 3 головы КРС. Для развития своего бизнеса в животноводстве, Бурулкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телки. 
В дальнейшем Бурулкан планирует расширить хозяйство путем увеличения поголовья крупнорогатого скота, а так же строительства большого сарая. В будущем женщина мечтает купить автомобиль для своей семьи.
.
texts.en:
Burulkan was born in the village of Belovodsk (in the Moscow region of the Kyrgyz Republic) to a large low-income cattle-farming family (eleven kids).  After nine years at the village school she went to a construction vocational school for three years. Ever since she was a child Burulkan helped her parents around the house, looking after the younger children and tending the cattle.

When she was twenty, Burulkan got married.  At first she and her husband lived with her parents in Belovodsk.  A year later their first son was born, and the year after that their second son.  In 1993, after saving up some money, Burulkan and her husband bought a house in the village of Petrovka (in the Moscow Region, seven km from Belovodsk) and got some milk-cows.  In 1996 their daughter was born. At that point they they had two milk cows and two steer.

In 2002 Burulkan and her husband sold the cattle and the house in Petrovka and bought a small home in the city of Kara-Balta.  Burulkan's husband landed a job as soccer coach at a kids' sports academy, where he works to this day.  At that time they had a calf and a steer. By and by the calf grew into a milk cow and they sold the steer so they could buy a calf.

In 2005 Burulkan sold off some of the cattle to marry off her eldest son. Now her son and his wife live and work in Russia and help out their parents financially while their son lives with Burulkan. Burulkan doesn't have any cattle for the time being because she and her husband built a new cinder block fence and put up new metal gates and a three-cow barn.  In order to grow their livestock business, Burulkan has requested a loan of 40,000KGS from Bai Tushum & Partners to buy some calves.

In the future Burulkan plans to improve the farm by getting more cattle and building a bigger barn. She dreams of buying a car for the family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a businessman who is 27 years old. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last 10 years, he has been repairing vehicles and motorbikes to earn a living. In the next five years, he wants to become financially stable. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy motorbike spare parts. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to manage his business through his previous loans.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beans

loans.name: Leornard

texts.en: Leornard is a hardworking business man aged 39. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last nine years, he has been selling DVDs to earn a living. He works in his business so as to provide for his family and provide quality education for his children. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of 90,000 Kenya shillings to buy DVDs.

loans.use: To buy DVDs

loans.name: Bunavsha

texts.ru:
Бунавша умная и добрая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Она занимается купля продажей продукты питания на местном рынке. Она продает макароны, печенье, конфеты и другие виды продукты питания. Она очень старается улучшить свою семейную жизнь и обучить своих детей в престижных школах и  университетах. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500$ США для покупки нового ассортимента продукты питания с целью расширения бизнеса. Она заранее хочет благодарит всем кредиторам за их помощь и доброты. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Bunavsha is a smart and kind woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of three children.  She is involved in buying and selling food products at the local market.  She sells pasta, cookies, candy and other types of food products.  Bunavsha tries hard to improve her family life and place her children into prestigious schools and universities.  She is requesting a loan of the sum of $2500 for the purchase of a new assortment of food products in order to expand her business.  She thanks all creditors in advance for their help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of food products

loans.name: Jessica's Group

texts.en:
Jessica’s group is comprised of six hard working women. Jessica is 22 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Jessica has a tailoring business, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Jessica has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials, and an electrical machine for making clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jessica hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. In the future, Jessica hopes to expand her business. Jessica is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials, and an electrical machine for making clothes for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a businessman aged 37. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last three years, he has been selling caps, key holders and belts to provide for his family. He also practices dairy farming for more income generation. In the next five years, he wants to buy a piece of land for business purposes. He is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy two heifers.

loans.use: To buy two heifers

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a focused businesswoman aged 41. She is married and blessed with five children. For the last five years, she has been managing a green-grocery to make a living. In the next five years, she wants her business to become successful.  She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and vegetables. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become more business-oriented.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old, married, and blessed with two children.  To earn a living, she sells second-hand shoes.  She has been in the business for four years.  She has employed two people to assist her in the business.  She also owns rental houses which earn her extra income.  Previously, she used to operate a salon.

Grace hopes to expand her business within five years.  She has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Durel Persyl

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 30 ans , célibataire sans enfant ,ayant arrete ses etudes en cours moyen elementaire a l'ecole  primaire , il se lance dans la prestation des services des jeux electroniques  en 2006 , il  ouvre une salle de jeux et a l'heure actuelle ,il a 6 postes televiseurs.
A l'otroi de son pret il va acheter  2 postes televiseurs de 14 pouces  en couleurs   et les programmes des jeux appropries et  un groupe electrogene , meme en temps coupure d'electricite de  continuer a faire fonctionner ses televiseurs et sa salle de jeux.
Il a des recettes de 6000 à 20.000 F Cfa par jour.Avec les bénéfices de son commerce, il pense épargner et à longue  ouvrir une autre salle de jeux.
texts.en: Durel is a 30 year old single man who, despite having not graduated from elementary school, began working in the electronic gaming business in 2006 by opening a game salon/room. Since the opening of his business five years ago, it has continued to grow, and he now owns six color televisions for his customers. He is asking for a loan in order to purchase two 14-inch color televisions, new electronic games and a small generator to enable his customers to continue gaming despite power outages. He earns between 6,000 and 20,000 FCA daily (approximately between 12 and 41 USD). He plans to continue saving money and hopes to open a second gaming room in the future.

loans.use: two 14 inch color televisions, new games and controllers and a small generator

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 56 years old, married, and has seven children.  To earn a living, he runs a cafeteria.  He has been in the business for seven years and has employed seven people.  Through Faulu Kenya, he was able to get permanent business premises.  His dream is to build rental houses so that he can generate more income for his family.

Paul has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy utensils and ingredients such as maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy utensils and ingredients such as maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is a hardworking businesswoman aged 51. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last two years, she has been managing poultry farming to earn a living. She also does embroidery to earn extra income. In the next five years, she wants to increase the number of layers she has. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy more chickens.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Winnie's Group

texts.en:
Winnie’s group is comprised of five hard-working women. Winnie is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Winnie has a small restaurant, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food, charcoal, and plates for the restaurant.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Winnie hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  

In the future, Winnie hopes to own a retail shop.   Winnie is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future.

loans.use: to purchase food, charcoal, and plates for the restaurant.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth lives in GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is 36 and married to Ferdinand, an overseas contract worker, with whom she has three children. Her oldest child is already in college, while the youngest is still in elementary school. Along with her husband, she works hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Lilibeth sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through direct sales programs such as Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. When a customer orders a product, Lilibeth orders it from the company, and the customer is given one month to pay his or her bill. Her customers are her neighbors and people in her community.  Each week, she earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from sales.

Lilibeth plans to use this 10,000 PHP loan as up-front cash to fulfill orders for her customers. She hopes the loan will enable her to expand her business and boost her income. 

Lilibeth faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other direct sales products

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años es casada y tiene tres hijos los cuales tienen 12, 10 y 1 año de edad; vive con su familia en Atuntaqui. Se considera como una persona emprendedora con deseos de superación.

Trabaja con su esposo e hijos en la crianza de animales, empezó con su negocio desde hace 7 años. Es la primera vez que trabaja con FODEMI y el crédito que solicita es para la compra de cuyes y cerdos para aumentar su negocio de la crianza de animales lo cual le ayudará a incrementar sus ventas e ingresos al mismo tiempo.

Su sueño es comprar un terreno grande para criar todo tipo de animales de granja para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old, married, and has three children aged 12, 10 and 1.  She lives with her family in Atuntaqui.  María considers herself to be an entrepreneurial person who has a desire to do well.

María works together with her husband and children raising animals.  She started her business seven years ago.  This is the first time that she has worked with FODEMI and she will use the loan that she is requesting to buy guinea pigs and pigs to increase her animal-raising business.  This will help her to increase her sales and profits at the same time.

María's dream is to buy a large plot of land so that she can raise all kinds of farmyard animals for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and pigs

loans.name: Rachael's Group

texts.en:
Rachael’s group is comprised of five hard-working women. Rachael is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zana in central Uganda.  She is married and has two children and one of her children is currently in school.  Rachael has had a clothes-washing business for two years.         

To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from Kiva field partner BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase an iron box and more basins to make doing laundry easier.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Rachael hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Rachael hopes to own a retail shop. Rachael is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which may help her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase an iron box and more basins for washing laundry

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes’s group is comprised of three hard-working women. Agnes is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zana in central Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Agnes has been a pig farmer for two years.         

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva field partner BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase pig feed.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Agnes hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Agnes hopes to expand her business.

Agnes is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which offers her lessons on ways to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es:
Mayra tiene 20 años es soltera y tiene una hija de tres años de edad, vive en Atuntaqui con su madre y su hija. Mayra se describe como una persona amigable, tranquila y muy trabajadora.

Trabaja en la crianza de animales como son los cerdos. Es la primera vez que le solicita créditos a FODEMI el mismo que va a utilizar para la compra de cerdos para incrementar su negocio y así vivir tranquila con su hija.

Su sueño es tener una casa con un terreno para poder criar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Mayra is 20 years old, single, and has a 3-year-old daughter.  She lives in Atuntaqui together with her mother and daughter.  Mayra describes herself as a friendly, calm and very hard-working person.

Mayra raises animals (pigs).  This is the first time that she has requested a loan from FODEMI and she will use the money to buy pigs in order to increase her business and thereby be able to live peacefully with her daughter.

Mayra's dream is to own a house with a plot of land where she can raise her animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different styles of footwear

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, desD. hace 4 años se dedica a la venta D. pupusas, hasta la fecha ha sido un negocio estable, apoyada por su esposo y sus hijos.
Ella solicita su segundo préstamo para la mejora del negocio e invertirlo en materiales D. la pupuseria, papel, salsas, maíz, aceite, gas, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar sus ventas, produciendo más.
El propósito D. ella es tener el apoyo financiero, para poder desarrollar el negocio, mantenerse siempre con sus clientes y estar en armonía con su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and her two children. For four years she has sold pupusas (tortillas filled with cheese and other fillings, a specialty of El Salvador). Up to this point it has been a stable business, supported by her husband and children.

She is asking for her second loan to improve her business and to invest in supplies for the pupseria: paper, sauces, corn, and oil. This purchase will help her improve her sales, producing more.

Her intention is to have financial support in order to be able to develop the business, to always keep her clients, and to be in harmony with her family.

loans.use: to purchase paper, sauces, corn, oil, and gas fuel for the pupuseria.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 19 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Sylvia has a business of a salon and cosmetics, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids, and lotions for the body, for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Sylvia hopes to become a big business woman.  Sylvia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital that has helped her build a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase braids, and lotions for the body, for resale.

loans.name: Carmen De Jesus

texts.es:
Carmen, vive con sus hijos D. 25 y 30 años D. edad,  quienes la apoyan mucho, ella se dedica a la venta D. frutas y verduras, este negocio lo tiene desD. hace 9 años, lo atienD. todos los días D. la semana.
Esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para la compra D. verduras y frutas, con esta inversión espera aumentar su atención y buen servicio a los clientes, su compra será en tomates, cebollas, plátanos, manzanas, uvas, sandia, bananas.
El objetivo es seguir en el negocio, ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos D. la casa.
texts.en:
Carmen lives with her children who are 25 and 30 years old and proviD. her with a lot of support.  Carmen sells fruit and vegetables and has owned her business for nine years.  She serves in it every day of the week.

Carmen is requesting a new loan to buy fruit and vegetables.  Through this investment, she hopes to proviD. a better service to her customers.  She will buy tomatoes, onions, plantains, apples, grapes, watermelon and bananas.

Carmen's goal is to continue in her business and help her children with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, bananas, apples, grapes and watermelon for her business

loans.name: Brenda Esmeralda

texts.es:
Brenda, vive con su esposo y su hija de 3 años de edad, tiene 9 años de vender comida, este negocio le ayuda para solventar algunas necesidades en su hogar.
Ella solicita por segunda vez un préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda y productos para hacer las meriendas como: bebidas,  carnes, aceite, lácteos y condimentos.
El objetivo de Brenda es que a través de dichos préstamos pueda mejorar su condición de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Brenda lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter.  She has been selling food for nine years.  This business helps her to cover some of her household needs.

Brenda is requesting her second loan to buy merchandise for her store and supplies for making afternoon snacks such as drinks, meat, oil, dairy products and seasonings.

Brenda's goal is, through these loans, to be able to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy drinks, meat, oil, dairy products and seasonings

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra est une femme mariée de 39 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle évolue depuis 3 ans dans le commerce  plus précisément  la vente de thioups  et de chaussures.  Elle a choisi cette activité  dans le but de lutter contre l’oisiveté et aussi de se procurer des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir a ses besoins personnels.  Ce qui l’intéresse le plus c’est l’aspect lucratif de son activité. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de thioups et de chaussures  destinés a  renforcer son stock  pour la fête de korité qui se préparait. Elle souhaite augmenter ses bénéfices pour mieux se prendre en charge financièrement
texts.en:
Diarra, age 39, is married and lives in Senegal. For three years, she's been selling thioups (dyed fabrics) and shoes. She chose this business in order to fight idleness and earn an income to provide for herself. She's interested in the money earning aspects of her business.

She's been a member of Kiva's partner, UIMCEC, since April 2011. She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000 intended to buy thioups and shoes to bolster her stock in preparation for Eid ul-Fitr. She would like to increase her profits to better support herself financially.

loans.use: to buy and resell thioups (dyed fabrics) and shoes

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
Joweria is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Joweria has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Joweria has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Joweria hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Joweria hopes to expand her business.   Joweria is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improve her business that has helped her go to school.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz tiene 49 años es casada y tiene tres hijos, vive en Tulcán con su familia. Se describe como una persona tranquila, muy trabajadora y le gusta ser amigable.

Trabaja en su negocio ambulante vendiendo papas asadas, es el primer crédito que requiere de FODEMI el mismo que va a utilizar en la compra de papas, gaseosas y sillas para sus clientes lo cual le ayudará a tener más credibilidad con su negocio.

Su sueño es crecer economicamente para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is 49 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives in Tulcán with her family. She describes herself as a calm person, very hard-working, and she enjoys being friendly.

She works in her business as a street vendor selling roasted potatoes. This is her first loan from FODEMI, and she will use it to purchase potatoes, soft drinks, and chairs for her clients, which will help her to have more credibility for her business.

Her dream is to grow financially in order to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, soft drinks, and some chairs for her customers

loans.name: Ndeye Marie

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye est une divorcée de 51 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le commerce c'est-à-dire la vente de produits divers tels que tissus, parfums, encens, chaussures et lampes électriques. Elle a choisi cette activité par amour. Elle est très passionnée  par la persévérance, l’abnégation, et la volonté de réussir que lui procure son activité de commerce. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis décembre  2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs prévu pour renforcer son capital  de roulement. Le montant emprunté sera destiné a  l’achat de  produits   qui sont très demandés  par la clientèle  durant le mois de Ramadan. Son objectif est d’améliorer ses gains financiers et aussi développer son activité.
texts.en: Ms. Ndeye is 51 years old and divorced. She lives in Senegal. She works as a vendor, selling various products such as cloth, perfumes, incense, shoes and electric lamps. She has chosen this business activity because she enjoys it. She is very dedicated and shows perseverance and willingness to make sacrifices in order to make her business succeed. She has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since December 2010. She is seeking a loan of 75,000 West African Funds in order to bolster her working capital. The loaned funds will be used to stock up on goods which are in high demand by customers during the month of Ramadan. Her goal is to increase her revenues and also to grow her business further.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 30 years old and is married with one child who is 2 years old. Her business is well-organized and is well known in this business of selling various African cloths. Her business hours are from 7am until 5pm every day except on Saturday and she currently employs one person to help her.

Claudine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more African cloths for sale. With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for the future. Claudine hopes also to renovate her house with her profits.

loans.use: To purchase various African cloths to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his children's travel expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales y alimenticios, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, tienen casa propia, el inicio el negocio con su familia hace 15 años, actualmente es el que le cubre todas sus necesidades, dicho negocio trata sobre la venta de productos naturales medicinales, también suplementos alimenticios.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos, medina natural, cereales para dietas, suplementos alimenticios,  que le ayuden para mejorar su servicio para con los clientes.
El objetivo de francisco es que con la inversión, estará más capaz para atender la demanda de los clientes y velara mejor por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco sells medicines and food products.  He lives with his wife and children and they own their own home.  He started this business with his family 15 years ago and it currently covers all his needs.  His business is selling natural medicines and also food supplements.

Francisco is requesting a loan to buy natural medicines, diet cereals and food supplements which will help him to improve his service to his customers.

Francisco's aim is, as a result of this investment, to be more able to meet his customers demands and look out for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines, diet cereals and food supplements

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 34 years old and he is married with six children aged between 1 and 11 years old and he takes care of three relatives. He sells various goods such as juice, water, biscuits, lotions, sugar etc and he has ten years experience in this business. He works from 7am until 8pm every day except on Saturday and he currently employs two people to help him.

Jean Claude has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more goods such as juice, water, biscuits, lotions, sugar, rice, salt, eggs etc for sale. Once his business is expanded, Claude hopes to reinvest in this business and save in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as juice, water, biscuits, sugar etc for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 26 years old and he is married with one child. He sells various goods such as cosmetics, sugar etc and he has eight years experience in this business. He currently employs one person to help him and he works from 8am until 8pm every day except on Saturday.

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more goods such as cosmetics, biscuits, sugar, rice, salt etc for sale. Once his business is expanded, Emmanuel hopes to reinvest in this business and to save in the future and he will be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Blanca tiene 43 años de edad es soltera con 3 hijos, ella es una mujer emprendedora que vive en una zona rural del país.

La señora Blanca se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas desde hace 9 años, fue su madre quien le enseño esta actividad, puesto que ella antes trabajaba prestando sus servicios como ama de casa por 3 años.

Para elaborar las tortillas, la señora Blanca tiene que comprar maíz, cal y leña 2 veces por semana. Por lo que ella solicita el crédito para poder adquirir la materia prima que necesita para la producción de sus tortillas, ya que con el poco capital con el que cuenta no puede dar abasto a la demanda existente en la comunidad.

La señora Blanca manifiesta que al incrementar la venta de sus tortillas también podrá incrementar sus ganancias, con lo que planea hacer un ahorro para en un futuro comprar un lote y construir su vivienda, puesto que actualmente ella esta alquilando y lo que desea es darles a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca, 43, is single and has three children.  She’s an enterprising woman who lives in a rural part of the country.

Blanca has been making tortillas for the last 9 years. Her mother taught her this activity because she used to work as a housekeeper for three years.

To make the tortillas, Blanca has to buy corn, lime powder and firewood twice a week.  Because of this she’s asking for a loan to be able to acquire raw materials needed to make tortillas because the little capital she has available is insufficient to meet the demand that exists in the community.

Blanca states that by increasing tortilla sales she will be able to increase profits that she plans to use to save up to buy a lot in the future and build her house because she’s currently renting and she wants to provide her children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and pay cash for rice, oil, grains and meats.

loans.name: Hoyo Del Toro 1, 2, 4 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of the group Hoyo del Toro, named in honor of their community name. This is a small community on the road to San Pedro D. Macoris and this group has 20 business people. Carmen is a young mother of three children. 

Carmen sells clothes, especially second hand clothes, in a flea market close to her community. When the Esperanza program went to her community, she decided to have a loan for her business, after 10 loans she has been able to establish her business and to proviD. for her family. She will invest this loan to buy a bag of used clothes and blankets.

Carmen said that her most biggest challenge is to raise her children into a better enviroment, she wants to give them a safer life, and with few needs as possible; she is working to proviD. school, food, clothes and other needs. She enjoys learning and taking care of her children. 

She is dreaming to see her children attend the University, graduate and become professionals. Thank you! 

Carmen is the lady on the right bottom in the picture.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes and blankets

loans.name: 18 En La Fe Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “18 en la Fe”, está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales  se encuentran la venta de joyas, venta de productos para adelgazar, servicios de masoterapia, confección y venta de ropa de cama, bazar, kiosco, tejidos y preparación de tortas. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Estación Central, ciudad de Santiago. 
Mirtha quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila agachada de derecha a izquierda, se dedica a la venta de joyas desde hace 3 años. 
Comenta que le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y que además mantiene un buen número de clientes.
Su mercadería la compra en una distribuidora en la cual realizan ventas para comerciantes. Además se dedica a vender cosméticos por catalogo y lencería.
Con el crédito comprará lencería, por lo que la encargará a su hermana quien trabaja en una distribuidora. 
Sus metas en sus negocios son invertir una gran cantidad de dinero, para comprar joyas y vender a comerciantes, una de sus expectativas es tener una distribuidora, para abastecer a los pequeños negocios.  
Mirtha vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 16, 11, 4 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños son estabilizarse económicamente para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Otro de sus sueños es tener una boutique para niñas, para compatibilizarlo con el negocio de una de sus amigas quien vende zapatos y ropa de niñas.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda brindada por Fondo Esperanza. El grupo del Banco comunal al cual pertenece es muy comprometido, responsable, solidario y organizado. 
Estación Central es una comuna emplazada en el área céntrica de Santiago (capital de Chile), que debe su nombre a la Estación Central de Ferrocarriles, que data del año 1887, declarada Monumento Nacional en 1983. En sus inicios esta estación, junto con la estación Mapocho, fueron la entrada a la capital en el tramo Valparaíso -  Santiago y también desde la zona sur del país.
texts.en:
This community bank is called '18 en la Fe'.  It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who are engaged in different business activities including selling jewelry, selling slimming products, providing massage (therapy), making and selling bed linen, running a general store, running a kiosk, knitting and making cakes.  All the members of the bank live in Estación Central, in the city of Santiago.

Mirtha, who in the photo is kneeling down in the front row on the right, has been selling jewelry for three years.  She says that her business has done very well and that she has a good number of customers.  She buys her merchandise from a wholesalers where they sell to people who sell retail.  She also sells cosmetics through a catalog and underwear.

Mirtha will use her loan to buy underwear which she will order from her sister who works at a wholesalers.  Mirtha's goals for her businesses are to invest a large quantity of money so that she can buy jewelry and sell to retailers.  She also plans to own a wholesalers so that she can supply small businesses.

Mirtha lives together with her husband and her four children who are 16, 11, 4 and 2 years old.  One of her dreams is to achieve financial stability so that she can provide her children with a better quality of life.  Another of her dreams is to own a boutique selling clothes for young girls.  She will merge it with the business of one of her friends who sells shoes and clothes for young girls.

Mirtha is very happy and grateful for the help provided by Fondo Esperanza.  The members of her community bank are very committed, responsible, supportive and organized.

Estación Central is a community which is located in the central area of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  It takes its name from the 'Estación Central de Ferrocarilles' (Central Railway Station) which dates back to 1887 and was named a national monument in 1983.  Originally this station, together with Mapocho station, was the entrance to the capital city on the Valparaíso - Santiago line and also on routes from the south of the country.

loans.use: to buy underwear which she will order from her sister who works at a wholesalers

loans.name: C9605 Muyange I Group

texts.en:
Innocent is 31 years old and he is married with five children aged between 2 and 14 years old. He sells Irish potatoes and maize. Innocent is the team leader of this group which is called "MUYANGE I" in local language and he is the first person on the left side.  He has ten years of experience in this business. He works from 7am until 7pm every week except on Saturday and he currently employs four people to help him. 

Innocent and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses by purchasing more products such as Irish potatoes and maize for sale. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to reinvest in this business and to save in the future. Innocent will also be able to pay school fees for hischildren.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantities of Irish potatoes and maize for sale.

loans.name: Rosario Sotera

texts.es:
La señora Rosario Sotera, es casada tiene 45 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la tejeduría de telas típicas, inició este trabajo como operaria para otro negocio, y tiene 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien también se dedica al mismo oficio.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilo ya que espera mejorar su producción y sus ingresos, mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Rosario Sotera, is 45 and married. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She weaves traditional fabrics. She started doing this work as an operator for another business and has 5 years of experience.  She has the support of her husband who works in the same trade. 

She decided to apply for a loan in order to buy thread, as she hopes to increase her production and income, and thereby improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy thread for weaving.

loans.name: Roberto Bladimir

texts.es: Roberto Bladimir de veinticinco años de edad vive con su madre y su hermano en casa propia. El posee una venta de verduras y una pupuseria en su lugar de residencia, es muy conocido en la localidad pues comercia verduras frescas de muy buena calidad y las pupusas que hace su mamá y vende por las noches tienen un sabor inigualable las más ricas de la zona todo a precios accesibles, además el servicio que ofrece a la clientela es excelente, Roberto se caracteriza por ser un hombre amable y dedicado al trabajo, para él los mejores éxitos se construyen con esfuerzo y constancia; es muy visionario y quiere ver crecer su negocio por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar chicharrón, queso, frijoles, tomates, cebollas, papas, aguacates, chiles, etc. Roberto Bladimir tiene la confianza de que con su trabajo y la ayuda de INTEGRAL logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
25-year-old Roberto Bladimir lives with his mother and brother in their own home.  He has a vegetable stall and a pupuseria in his home and is very well known in his town because he sells very good-quality fresh vegetables and the pupusas which his mom makes and he sells in the evenings have an unrivalled taste.  They are the most delicious in the area and they sell them at affordable prices.  In addition, Roberto's customer service is excellent.  He is noted as being a kind man who is committed to his work.  For Roberto, the best successes are made from effort and determination.  Roberto is very visionary and he would like to see his business grow.  For this reason, he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL which would allow him to buy pork rinds, cheese, beans, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, avocados, chilis, etc.

Roberto Bladimir believes that through his work and the help of INTEGRAL, he will manage to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pork rinds, cheese, beans, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, avocados and chilis

loans.name: Iskra Tamara

texts.es: Iskra Tamara tiene 27 años, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo. Desde hace mas de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios son con esfuerzos propios, pues desde muy joven su Mama le enseño a ganarse la vida. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos, la mayoría de sus clientes son amigos, vecinos y familiares. A pesar de las difíciles situaciones que ha enfrentado sigue con esta actividad. Ella invertirá el financiamiento en materia prima como frutas, bolsas, pajillas, azúcar y otros productos. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda, pues todavía no tiene ciertos servicios básicos.
texts.en: Iskra Tamara is 27. She has 3 young children who are under her care. She has had her business, which she stared on her own, for over 4 years. From a very young age, her mother taught her how to make her living. Her business is selling drinks. The majority of her customers are friends, neighbours and family members. Despite the difficult situations that she has faced, she continues with her work. She will invest this loan in basic materials such as fruit, bags, straws, sugar, and other products. She dreams of improving her home, since she does not have certain basic services.

loans.use: to buy fruit, bags, straws, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Diego Alejandro

texts.es: El Joven Diego se dedica a la costura y venta balones de futbol solicita el crédito para la compra de materia para la costura de los balones ( cuero, pegamento y pinturas de distintos colores  además de otros materiales ) ya que en estas fechas  por  las fiestas que hay en la localidad de Quillacollo existe gran pedido de balones de futbol y necesita capital para poder comprar material para la costura de balones, se dedica a esta actividad hace seis  años como propietario se dedica a esta  actividad  desde su niñez ya que su padre se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya mas de veinte años. Sus padres indican que es muy responsable  y  que colabora en el hogar con los ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Young Diego makes and sells soccer balls. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of material for making the balls (leather, adhesive, and different-coloured paints, and other materials), as there is great demand for soccer balls at the moment due to the parties in Quillacollo. He needs capital in order to be able to buy material for making the balls. He has been a business owner for six years but has done this work since he was a child, as his father has also done this work for over 20 years. His parents say that he is very responsible and that he helps out with the household costs.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making soccer balls.

loans.name: Rosa Areli

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella aprendió  negocio de la medicina por su esposo, quien le enseño los precios, hoy en día trabaja de forma ambulante, no tiene horario fijo, y a través de sus ventas ha logrado mantenerse y apoyar a su hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de medicina, antibióticos, analgésicos, vitaminas y más,  toda esta mercadería es necesaria para ofrecer a los clientes, dando un buen servicio y teniendo para cada enfermedad un medicamento.
El objetivo de ella es tener un local bien establecido, incrementando sus ganancias y apoyando a su familia
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and one child. She learned the medicine business from her husband, who taught her. She currently sells in street markets and has no fixed schedule. Through her sales she has been able to maintain herself and help support the household. 
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of medicine, antibiotics, painkillers, vitamins and more. She needs all of this merchandise to offer to her customers, providing a good service and having a medicine for every illness.
Her goal is to have a well-established store, increase her income and support her family.

loans.use: to buy antibiotics, painkillers and vitamins for sale.
